loans.name: Basooka Kwavula Development Association-Mityana Group

texts.en: 63-year-old K. Walusansa worked as a government veterinary officer before he decided to start his current cattle and poultry business 12 years ago. K. is married with 21 children, all of whom have completed school. Aside from the aforementioned business, he also operates a farm in Masaka. His weekly profits equal 500,000 shillings. With this loan, he is going to buy medicines to treat his animals and buy more chicken feed. He is affiliated with the Basooka Kwavula development association-Mityana.

loans.use: The purchase of medicines to treat his animals and also buy more chicken feed

loans.name: Anna M.

texts.en:
Anna is a woman of 54 years, married to G., who is a farmer. She stays in Kalii, Emali which is a peri-urban area.  She operates a general shop where she sells food items like flour, salt, sugar, cooking oil, etc. This is her primary business which she has been running for the last six years. Her secondary business is farming which she does on the family farm and later selling the produce at a profit.
 
She came to know about KADET through a community awareness event, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she plans to add more stock with the following items: sugar, bales of flour, rice, salt, and others for Kshs 10,000, and also she wants to invest the rest in farming.

She hopes to give her family a better life.

loans.use: To invest in farm & to restock her retail shop

loans.name: C6207 Abishyizehamwe Group

texts.en:
Janviere is 26 years old and is married with two children who are 6 months and 3 years old.  She is the president of a group called “Abishyizehamwe” and this group is commonly known for selling a variety of goods in their various businesses, such as clothes, foodstuffs, gasoline, etc. 

Janviere and her team are now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to satisfy the demand of their customers which keeps increasing beyond their financial capacity.  With the use of this loan, Janviere and her team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will be used to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Heriknaz

texts.en:
Heriknaz A. lives in Yerevan with her husband, sister-in-law and her son. Heriknaz first worked in a self-service store as a cashier and later in a shoe factory. In 1991, Heriknaz and her husband left Armenia for Bulgaria where they managed their own shop. After 5 years, they have returned home and Heriknaz started a business renting a space at the trade fair where she sells a variety of toys, including mechanical, musical, and educational toys. 

Heriknaz’s first Kiva loan allowed her to organize mixed products trading in her shop and place a stall with mixed products for resale in front of her rented shop. Now, she is requesting a loan of 500, 000 AMD to buy a lot of toys for her shop in view of the New Year's holidays. This is Heriknaz’s eleventh loan from Nor Horizon and her second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy toys for her shop in view of the New Year's holidays

loans.name: Elba Del Socorro

texts.es:
Elba de 28 años de edad, vive en la Ciudad de Nueva Guinea, costado sur del Parque, es madre soltera de un niño de 5 añitos, vive con su mamá que que le ayuda cuidandole a su hijo cuando ella sale a trabajar, recibe ayuda para el niño por parte del papá, ella trabaja como docente desde hace  4 años en la Escuela Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell ubicada en la zona # 1 de Nueva Guinea,  esta joven es una mujer bien responsable, honesta y  trabajadora  que ha luchado para que a su hijo no le falte lo basico en el hogar.  

Esta solicitando su segundo crèdito, para remodelar su vivienda y asi brindar mejores condiciones a su linda familia. 

Su mayor sueño en la vida es que su hijo estudie para que sea un hombre de bien y que goce de mucha salud.
texts.en:
Elba is 28 years old and lives in the city of Nueva Guinea, on the south side of the Park.  She is a single mother and has a 5 year-old child.  Elba lives with her mom who helps her by looking after her son when she goes out to work.  She receives help from the child's father.  Elba has been working as a teacher at Cesar Augusto Salinas Pinell School which is located in Area #1 of Nueva Guinea for four years.  This young woman is very responsible, honest and hard working and she has worked hard so that her son doesn't want for any essentials in their home.

Elba is requesting her second loan to remodel her home and thereby provide better conditions for her beautiful family.  Her biggest dream in life is for her son to study so that he becomes a good man and for him to enjoy good health.

loans.use: To remodel her home

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab, 51, lives in Okara, a small Pakistani city known for its agriculture industry. She resides in the small housing colony named Faisal Mehmood with her family in a two-room brick house. Zainab is a housewife, preferring to stay at home and and discharge her household responsibilities. She is also an expert in sewing clothes, earning family income by sewing for her neighboring clients.

Zainab is a mother of seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her elder son works in a Punjabi food restaurant, while her daughter also sews clothes. Five are at home, while two others are getting their education. Her husband, M. R., runs a shop in the market where he sells construction supplies to his regular customers and also to the building constructors.

Zainab has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business, which she has operated for over 10 years. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine which will help her work more efficiently and complete orders on time, as her current machine has become old and incapable of producing quality work. She is hopeful that an investment will earn her more profits.

Zainab is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her fifth loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit history and has faithfully attended all meetings.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Lok

texts.en:
Mr. Lok T. is a villager who lives in Kaoh Prak village in Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land that he uses to cultivate vegetables to sell to support his family. He would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing vegetables on his farm. The rest of the loan he wants use to buy bamboo to build a vegetable trellis. His wife, Mrs. Chea San, stays at home and also helps her husband with the farming. 
This couple has four children. Three of the children are seamstresses in a garment factory and the last one is a farmer. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for growing vegetables.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea T., 63, is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. T. and her husband are farmers, earning an income of USD 2 each per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 38 on food and USD 8 on other necessary expenses. 

T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase corn and bean seeds to grow. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy corn and bean seeds to grow

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
JORGE LUIS M. U., ES DE MANAGUA, TRABAJA EN MANTENIMIENTO,  Y POR LA NOCHE ESTUDIA INGENIERIA EN LA UNIVERSIDAD.
DON JORGE ACUDE A LAS OFICINAS DE CEPRODEL PARA SOLICITAR UN PRESTAMO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU VIVIENDA PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: CEMENTO, ARENA, BLOQUES PARA TERMINAR DE CONSTRUIR SU CASA DE HABITACION, YA QUE ESTA TODABIA NO ESTABA CONSTRUIDA EN SU TOTALIDAD. 
TODO ESTO PARA EL MEJORAMIENTO DE SU CASA DE HABITACION Y BRINDARLE MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SU FAMILIA.
A GRADECE A CEPRODEL POR EL PRESTAMO BRINDADO YA QUE AHORA SU FAMILIA CONTARA CON UNA MEJOR VIVIENDA.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis M. U. is from Managua. He is employed as a janitor and at night he is studying engineering in university. 

Jorge approached the offices of Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to make some home improvements. He will invest in the purchase of construction materials such as cement, sand, and construction blocks to finish building the house. It is not entirely built yet. these home improvements are to provide better living conditions to his family. 

He is thankful to Ceprodel for the loan and now his family will be able to have a better home.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Angel Domingo

texts.es:
Angel Domingo R. A. tiene 46 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y  con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Angel Domingo  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener terreno para sembrar.

Le gusta hacer deporte y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Angel Domingo R. A. is 64 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and their three single children in the Guaranda canton in the Bolívar province.  He has five children.  

The members of the Grupo Enmanuel Community Bank can be found in the San Juan precinct, which is in the Guaranda canton.  This bank has 17 members, farmers who grow large quantities of short cycle corn, wheat, and potatoes.  They also raise animals and sell them on Thursdays at the fair in the city of Guaranda.

He is requesting the loan to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes.  He will also buy animals and supplies to feed the animals and for his crops.  The support of the loan would financially help supply him with the necessities.

The challenges he faces are pest infestation, diseases, and climate change.

His dream is to have a field to sow.

He likes playing sports and going out with his family.

loans.use: to plant corn, wheat, and potatoes, and to buy animals

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es: Reyna, de 30 años de edad, es natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, esta casada con Simeón de 33 años y tienen 03 hijos juntos viven en su propia  casa en la comunidad de Pampa Miraflores caseríos del distrito de Santa Rosa. Reyna y su pareja, cuentan con muchos proyectos en mente, razón por la cual hace 03 años invirtieron sus ahorros en venta de repuestos para todo tipo de vehiculo motorizado. En su negocio le va muy bien  y existe mayor demanda por parte de sus clientes  y trabajan de la mano junto con su esposo. Le gusta este negocio a pesar de obtener buenas ganancias esta en plena comunicación con las personas. Los planes que tiene en mente es seguir creciendo económicamente y con el transcurso del tiempo abrir otra sucursal  en otros distritos. El crédito solicitado es para la adquisición de repuestos y lubricantes. Este es su octavo crédito con MFP, el dinero solicitado le será de mucha utilidad. En su banco comunal es una socia participe. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles solicitados, comprará accesorios para la venta de repuesto que realiza.
texts.en: Reyna is 30 years old and is from the District of Santa Rosa.  She is married to Simeón who is 33 and they have three children together.  They live in their own house in the community of Pampa Miraflores, a rural area in the District of Santa Rosa.  Reyna and her husband have many projects in mind, which is why they invested their savings in selling spare parts for all types of motor vehicles three years ago.  Their business is doing very well and there is greater demand from their customers.  They work closely together.  She likes this business since in addition to making a good profit, she is able to interact with people.  Her plans are to continue growing financially and to open another branch in other districts over time.  The loan requested is to obtain spare parts and lubricants.  This is her eighth loan with MFP and the money requested will be very useful for her.  She is a participating member in her communal bank.  With the 3,000 Peruvian Nuevos Soles (PEN) requested, she will buy accessories for her spare parts sales.

loans.use: to buy accessories for motor vehicles.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a twenty-seven-year-old single mother with one child. She rents a house in Kasese. Florence has been dealing in fresh foods for three years, a business she started with 300,000 UGX. She now has 800,000 UGX. Her problem is high transport costs.

Florence intends to use her profits to buy additional fresh foods. Her vision is to build a house and set up a food store.

loans.use: To buy fresh foods

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a hardworking, obedient and reliable lady.  With her personality, she is able to run her clothes-selling business in a competitive environment.  She has been running the business for almost four years and has employed one person.  She was previously selling vehicle spare parts to earn a livelihood for her family. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Hope

texts.en:
Retailing is 26-year-old N. Hope's business, one in which she has been giving a good account of herself for seven years now in Nabuti-Mukono. She says to get established in this enterprise, she was prevailed upon by her close friends who were already engaged in business. The single mother of one sells a variety of general merchandise that is in high demand amongst the people around her neighborhood.

Hard work and determination have been her calling cards, and weekly she earns profits of shillings 400,000. She will use this loan to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities to resell.

loans.name: Branny

texts.es: Branny, de 21 años, es una joven madre de familia muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Roger de 24 años y su querido hijo Ángel de 4 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Branny es una madre muy amorosa, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y del cual es muy solicitada por sus clientes, a quienes siempre les brinda una sonrisa, ya que sabe que ellos son muy importantes para el progreso de su negocio. Su metodología de trabajo, es la venta de casacas, chompas, pantalones, por catálogo. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, a quienes siempre hace reír, debido a la alegría que le pone a todo lo que hace. Lleva 2 años en este trabajo y lo que menos le gusta es tener que caminar bajo el intenso calor todos los días en busca de clientes. Anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender más prendas y atender mejor a su clientela, sabe que tiene que trabajar muy duro para mejorar su vida, ante esto pide el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda desarrollarse como comerciante. Es será su tercer crédito con MFP, por ello esta muy contenta, además tiene la confianza en que pagará a tiempo sus cuotas. En su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ropa para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Branny, 21, is a young, very kind and hard working mother living in her own house with her husband, Roger, 24, and her beloved son, Ángel, 4, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Branny is a very loving mother.  She sells clothes and is quite sought after by her customers that she always greets with a smile because she knows that they are important for her business’ progress.  Her working methodology is jacket, sweater and pants sales via catalogue.  What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers who she always makes laugh because of the joy she puts into everything she does.  She’s been in business for two years and what she least likes is having to walk under the intense heat every day looking for customers.  She dreams with having a store where she can sell more clothes and better tend to her customers.  She knows that she must work hard to improve her life and in face of that asks all of you for support so that she can develop as a merchant.

This will be her third loan with MFP.  She is very happy about that and is confident that she will repay her installments on time.  She is very respected in her communal bank because she always imposes order during the meetings.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more clothes to offer a wider variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with one child. Michelle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, biscuits, and beverages. She has had this business for three years and has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy more inventory. Michelle is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 44 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. 

Jonah has a general store and earns approximately 4,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase more products for her general store. 

Jonah became a member of PMPC just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 37 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda.  She is married and has 3 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Rose has a business that sells clothes, which she has had for less than one year.         

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy lives in  Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Cissy has a business of selling clothes. She has been in this business for one year. She works six days out of every week. Cissy sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Cissy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. The main business challenges for Cissy include transportation and the rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes herself and to start selling on a wholesale basis only. Cissy lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, el señor Carlos Manuel, tiene a su cargo una persona es luchadora, responsable, con buenos valores y principios  morales, que lucha para sacar adelante sus hijos para un futuro mejor. 

A esta oficina de ceprodel se presento  a solicitar crédito que será utilizado para remodelación de su vivienda, en hacer un porche,  para darle más seguridad  a su familia y agradece a ceprodel la oportunidad con este desembolso compra materiales de construcción tales como bloque, hierro, cemento, arena.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel is from the city of Managua, and he has one person under his care.  He is tenacious and responsible with good values and moral principles.  He works hard to get his children ahead in order to have a better future.

He came to this Ceprodel office to request a loan.  It will be used to remodel his home by building a porch to provide his family with more security.  He is grateful to Ceprodel for the opportunity.  With this loan he will buy construction materials like cement blocks, iron, cement, and sand.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Eliodoro

texts.en:
Eliodoro is cheerful and a humble father. He was blessed with three children and a responsible wife who does daily household chores. Despite poverty, the couple still aspires to provide a progressive living for the family.

Eliodoro was given a rice field as an inheritance from his parents, and he has cultivated it for 10 years now. He raise crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for future sale. According to him, typhoons, drought, pests and snails affect his crop production.

He is now requesting a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy fertilizers and moluscicides used in farming. Moluscicides are chemicals used for the treatment of pest and snails. 

Eliodoro hopes to surpass all the trials he has been encountering in his farming business and produce a better yield to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and moluscicides (chemicals used for the treatment of pests and snails) to use in farming.

loans.name: Mery Salome

texts.es:
Mery es socia del  Banco Comunal “Vallecito Vizcachani”, ubicado en el distrito y departamento de Puno, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene 5 hijos, uno de ellos es independiente.  Cuenta con educación primaria.
Su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles lo invirtió en su negocio de venta de verduras y flores, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace ocho años.
Con este nuevo préstamo  de  S/.  100.00 nuevo soles, invertirá en la compra de semillas de zanahoria, cebolla y flores, etc,  para el sembrío,  para luego venderlos.  Trabaja sola en el negocia su esposo trabaja en construcción civil.
La señora desea tener un puesto en el mercado y que su  negocio crezca.	
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo en períodos cortos
texts.en:
Mery’s a member of the “Vallecito Vizcachani” (Little Vizcachani Valley) communal bank located in Puno District and Department.  She’s 42 years old, married and has five children; one of them is independent.  She finished elementary school.

Her first loan was for 300 new soles and she invested it in her vegetable and flower sales business.  He’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the last 8 years.

She will use this new, 100 new sol loan, to buy carrot seeds, onions and flowers, etc. to grow and then sell.  She works alone in her business; her husband works in civil construction.  She hopes to have a stand in the market and that her business grows.  What she likes about the communal bank is the ease of short-term loans.

loans.use: to buy carrot seeds, onions and flowers, etc.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 58 years old and married, with 10 children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc,. in her sari sari store.

Dominga has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 4 years and also earns an income from furniture making.  Dominga aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell

loans.name: Marve

texts.en: Marve is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Marve has a retail shop that sells souvenir shirts, pajamas and bath towels. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy t-shirts needed for making souvenir shirts. Marve is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marve hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts needed for making souvenir shirts

loans.name: Hanz Nord

texts.es:
Hanz de 31 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Paijan que pertenece al departamento de La Libertad. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Hanz se dedica desde hace varios años a la crianza y comercialización de animales de corral (cuyes  y aves de corral), sus corrales los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, granos y pastos  naturales, una vez que lleguen a su peso  y tamaño ideal los ofrece a sus clientes en los diferentes mercados de la zona y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y para realizar arreglos en sus corrales, para engordarlos y luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados de su zona, con la finalidad de que obtenga un buen precio por ellos y así pueda tener mayores ganancias para brindarle a su esposa  una mejor calidad de vida.  Hanz  es una persona dedicada su trabajo y lo único que desea es poder brindarle a su familia algunas comodidades en su hogar y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Hanz, 31, lives with his wife and children in his own house that only has electricity and is located in Paijan District belonging to La Libertad Department, a zone noted for farming, animal husbandry and tourism.

Hanz has been raising small farm animals (guinea pigs and barnyard fowl) to sell for several years now.  His corrals are in his back yard and he feeds his animals nutritionally balanced feed, grains and natural grasses.  Once they reach ideal size and weight he sells them to customers in various local markets and uses income obtained from the sales to cover his daily household needs.

He has asked Edpyme Alternativa through its Seed Capital program for a 2500 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his animals and to do some repairs to the corrals to fatten his animals up and then sell them in the various local markets aiming for good prices for them to have higher profits to provide his wife with a better quality of life.  Hanz is a person who is dedicated to work and all he wants is to be able to provide his family with some comfort at home and that his business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to do some repairs to his corrals.

loans.name: Onester

texts.en:
Onester is 35 years old.  She is a married woman with three children, and all three are in the school. She has a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years.

Onester requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to be able to order more charcoal to sell. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 51 years old and married to George. Together they have four children ages 18, 23, 26, and 28 years old. She is a farmer and sells second hand clothes. She has been in the business for the past 10 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is her third loan term in KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for farming and also purchase some clothes for resale.


She will use the anticipated profit to purchase a dairy cow. Her dream is to own a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who currently attend school. For the past four years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her salon where she does hairdressing for local women. Elizabeth's loan group is comprised of two hardworking women. 

Elizabeth is requesting a 700,000 UGX loan to help expand her business and purchase equipment needed to do special braids. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Elizabeth hopes that in the future she will be able to own a boutique. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Elizabeth's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to do special braids

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer, trabajador y muy dedicada. Vive con Emilio y sus tres hijos de 20, 16 y 14 años, instalados en una casa que es de su propiedad, que lograron comprar con mucho esfuerzo. Edith  se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, para eso cuenta con una bodega que abrió en su casa, comenzando con muy poca mercadería que logró comprar gracias a un pequeño capital que tenía ahorrado, luego con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logró hacerse conocida y ampliar su negocio. Lleva dedicada a ese negocio desde hace 20 años, contando con el apoyo de sus hijos para atender a los clientes, que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos. Lo que le gusta de su actividad  es el poder socializarse, logrando hacer nuevas amistades, con los cuales puede intercambiar ideas; además del ingreso económico que le genera y puede apoyar con los gastos del hogar a su pareja que se dedica al servicio de mototaxi. Si embargo, los clientes le insisten en la venta a crédito, por lo que niega debido a la impuntualidad de pago. Así mismo tiene planes de ampliar su bodega, en espacio y diversidad de productos. Este será el préstamo número 24 con la institución MFP, por ello espera seguir contando con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes  como en créditos anteriores. Además de sentirse cómoda con su grupo de su banco comunal ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de productos en general para surtir su bodega, y así tener más acogida y preferencia de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edith, 47, is a hardworking and dedicated woman.  She lives with Emilio and their three children, who are 14, 16, and 20 years old, in a house that they own.  They were able to purchase the house with a lot of effort. 

Edith works selling necessity items in a general store located in her home.  She started her business with very little merchandise that she was able to buy with money she had saved.  Later, with a lot of effort and dedication, she became well known and expanded her store.  She has had this business for 20 years.  Her children help her serve her customers, who are mostly her neighbors.  The thing she likes best about her business is being able to socialize and make new friends with whom she can exchange ideas.  In addition to the income she earns that helps with household expenses, her husband works as a mototaxi driver.  However, some customers insist on payment on credit, but she denies them because they do not pay punctually.  

She has plans to expand her store, both in space and in the diversity of products offered.  This will be her 24th loan with MFP, and she hopes to continue working together so that she can achieve her goals, as with her previous loans.  She feels comfortable with her community bank group since she considers the members to be responsible and supportive people.  

With the loan requested, she will purchase necessities to stock her store so that she can have more options for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase necessities to stock her general store.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is 28 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has been selling fish for the last two years, with a monthly profit of KES 5,000. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and she is applying for her second loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase additional stocks of fish for sale. 

Kache plans to save the profit she makes and use it to help pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and own a fish depot in the area.

loans.use: to buy more fish for sale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha lives in Uganda.  She is married and has 8 children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her cousin).    Aisha   has a business selling non-alcoholic drinks.  She has been in this business for five years, and she works 7 days out of every week.  Aisha sells her products in a shop, retail.

Aisha has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of passion fruit and oranges, soda and boxes of mineral water. The main business challenges for Aisha include rainy season and increasing prices of soda and passion fruit in Uganda.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to  see her  business grow big and open up another branch selling the same non- alcoholic drinks and also to build rental houses.

 Aisha lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, boxes of mineral water, passion fruit and oranges.

loans.name: Albeiro De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Albeiro a sus 40 años de edad es padre de 10 hijos de 17, 14, 13, 12, 10, 8, 5, 4, 2 y 3 meses de edad, trabaja día a día arduamente para sacar adelante a su gran familia en su propio cultivo de papa, arveja y fríjol ubicado en su finca en una vereda del municipio de Sonson localizado al norte de Antioquia. En los últimos meses, el señor Albeiro ha tenido dificultades puesto que el invierno ha afectado en gran proporción su cultivo y no ha podido sacar la producción que esperaba, para lo cual necesita de la compra de abonos y riegos que le permitan recuperar su cultivo y la calidad de vida de su familia. El señor Albeiro tiene la esperanza de mejorar su cultivo y brindarle lo necesario para vivir a sus 10 hijos y esposa.
texts.en: Alberio is 40 years old and the father of 10 children, ages 17, 14, 13, 12, 10, 8, 5, 4, 2 and 3 months.  He works arduously on his own potato, pea, and bean crop to move his grand family ahead.  The crops are on his farm on a Sonson veranda, located north of Antioquina.   In the past few months Alberio has had difficulties because the winter has affected his crop and he has not been able to get the production he was hoping for, so he needs to buy fertilizer and pay for irrigation so he can recover his crop and his family’s quality of life.  He hopes to improve his crop and provide for his 10 children’s and his wife’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and irrigation.

loans.name: Suh

texts.en:
Suh was born in 1942 and is married  to one wife. He has three children, none of which are under 15 years old. He lives in a six room house at mile 90 Nsongwa, situated in the Northwest Region of Cameroon. He has encounter so many problems in life like sickness, death of family members and theft. He hates to think about accidents, sickness, court cases, poor harvest and the death of his parents. Since he joined GHAPE in 2005, he has taken out and repaid five loans without any repayment difficulties and he hopes his business is going to be a success because more effort will be put in and most farmers will need to buy manure for farming since it will soon be farming season.

With the excess from the loan preparing to take, he will  improve on his farming system and will provide his family with some basic needs. He prefers a loan from GHAPE because it is a not-for-profit organization and they lend out money at a cheap interest rate, taking into consideration the poor and giving enough time for the loan to be paid back without collateral.

loans.use: To buy oil, food items, to farm and rear pigs.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena forma parte del Banco comunal “El Almendral” perteneciente a la comuna de Peñalolén, ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro de la peluquería, desde hace tres años. Realizó algunos cursos de especialización, lo que le permitió perfeccionarse y emprender en su negocio. Específicamente en corte de pelo, peinados y tinturas.
Elena se desempeña en sus labores de peluquería de lunes a viernes y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que sus hijos son pequeños y ella es quien se dirige a los domicilios particulares de sus clientes.
Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora que se especializa en vender productos para el cabello.
Una de las metas de Elena en su negocio, son tener la oportunidad de abrir un local como salón de belleza, en el cual pueda atender a sus clientes. 
Con el crédito comprará un secador de pelo, una máquina rasuradora y tijeras.
Elena vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 17, 9 y 8 años de edad, sus sueños a nivel personales son brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como una momento de distracción.
Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera. 
Peñalolén se localiza al oriente de la región metropolitana. Cuenta con diversos atractivos tales como viñas, edificios considerados patrimonio histórico y sitios naturales de excursión, elementos que están transformando a esta comuna en un nuevo panorama turístico dentro de la región Metropolitana.
texts.en:
Elena is part of the El Almedral communal bank located in the town of Peñalolén, city of Santiago.  She has worked in the area of hairdressing for three years.  She took some specialized courses, which allowed her to improve herself and launch her business, specifically in haircuts, hairstyles, and dyes.

Elena performs her hairdressing duties from Monday through Friday, and she arranges her schedule according to her availability, since her children are young and it is she who goes to the homes of her different customers.  She buys her merchandise from a distributor that specializes in selling hair products.  One of Elena's business goals is to have the opportunity to open a store as a beauty salon where she can see her customers.

With the loan she will buy a hair dryer, an electric razor, and scissors.

Elena lives with her husband and three children, ages 17, 9, and 8.  Her personal dream is to give her family a better quality of life.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her because it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She also feels very comfortable with the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank group because they share different activities and interests, which also has served to distract her for a moment.  With regard to the training given in the meetings, she has learned to run her business better.

Peñalolén is located in the east of the metropolitan area.  It has various attractions such as vineyards, buildings considered part of the cultural heritage, and excursions to natural areas, elements that are changing this town into a new tourism scene within the metropolitan region.

loans.use: to buy a hair dryer, an electric razor, and scissors.

loans.name: Abdul's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfiance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you this group of teachers from Koidu, in eastern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of  7,000,000.00  SLL in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for the withholding and repayments. 

Abdul (pictured right) is the leader of this group of teachers. The 48-year-old man is a native of Koquima in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married and has four children – two in primary school, one in secondary school and one not of school going age. Abdul has been a professional teacher for the past twenty-six years. With his share of this loan, he is going to buy house building materials like cements, etc. for the construction of dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials like cements, etc. for the construction of dwelling house

loans.name: Tayorma Group

texts.en: Greetings are coming to you from members of the Tayorma Group. Members of the Tayorma Group are very pleased to inform you that thanks to the Kiva loans they have received, their businesses have seemed to have expanded and improved a great deal. Having finished repaying their last Kiva loan successfully, they are, however, again requesting a new loan of SLL 4,100,000. With the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their respective businesses, make more sales and get better profits. Doris remains the featured leader of this group. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy firewood, charcoal, and soap.

loans.use: to buy firewood, charcoal, and soap

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick is requesting for a loan to buy cocoa for resale, she is a 45-year-old married woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has three children, all of whom go to school. She is a cocoa farmer who has a cocoa plantation. She also buys cocoa from other people to supplement what she has harvested for selling. She hopes to expand her business of buying and selling cocoa and she is very committed to her business. She is affected by seasonality and market competition which fail her in realizing bigger profits.

She used the previous loan for cocoa business and the returns were good, hence the motivation to continue with cocoa business.

loans.use: Vick is requesting for a loan to buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Tuilagiula

texts.en:
Tuilagiula is married with three children. She completed her secondary school in Pago Pago. Prior to joining SPBD she worked as a plantation worker.
Her business is fishing which she does with her husband. He catches the fish and she sells them and manages the money. Fish are caught every day and usually she will sell to around 20 customers. The fish are sold by the road in her village. This is quite common in Samoa. The photo shows her standing at her road side stall with the fish hanging. In her hand is a swatter to keep the flies off the fish.

Tuilagiula is the secretary of her village lending group. This is an unpaid role where her job is to keep a record of all the payments and to facilitate the weekly payments. 

She has paid back five loans now with no penalties which places her in the top group of SPBD members and is a testament to her commitment and organisation.

loans.use: Fishing equipment, school fees, home improvement

loans.name: Reyna Cristina

texts.en:
Hi, my name is Reyna Cristina. I have run a clothing store in the center of my city for a number of years. It generates income to cover family expenses and also arrange deals with suppliers. Summer time is approaching and I need to supply my business with more seasonal products, keeping in mind that the sales volume will also be larger.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre el Reina Cristina, cuento con un negocio de veta de ropa de ambos sexos, ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad,tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio el que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos familiares y demas compromisos con los proveedores, aprovechando la temporada de verano necesito surtir mas mi negocio con producto de temporada tomando en cuenta que el volumen de venta es mayor.

loans.use: Buy sandals, swimsuits, shorts, towels, jeans and other seasonal clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The loan will be invested in the purchase of spare parts and materials necessary for conducting repairs.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Twenty-five year old Raquel has run an artisan business for the past six years. Her business has been growing steadily since she first started weaving chompas (sweaters), chalecos (vests), and chullos (hats). She has moved on to placing orders and purchasing from other women in Juliaca.

Raquel travels every weekend to the border town of Desaguadero where she sells her goods to Bolivians, tourists, and wholesalers. She has recently opened an email account, which allows her customers to contact her and let them order in a simpler manner. The main problem she is facing at the moment is that her clientele is growing at a much faster rate than her capital. She is asking for a $325 loan to increase the amount of merchandise she has as well as the amount of orders she can fill.

loans.use: Increase capital to augment stock of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria cohabitates with her partner and her six children, of whom only one helps in the business. When she and her husband separated, she was left with all the expenses of keeping house and raising her children, and the payment sent by her husband was not enough to cover these expenses. That was when she found a type of powdered milk and noted that she could sell it to her acquaintances. She discovered with the milk thanks to a friend who invited her to try it, and as it was quite good for her, she became interested in selling it. She began by selling it to her family and neighbors, and later she sold it at factories close to her home. She now has been at her business for a year and a half, and thanks to it, has been able to her family get ahead, but she wishes to be able to continue with the business and improve her quality of life.

Maria is requesting a loan for US $375 to purchase merchandise to offer her clients now that they are asking for many more products, and she is offering to pay the loan in six months. She and her children thank you for your support that you give her to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

María vive en unión libre con su pareja y tienen 6 hijos, de los cuales solo uno de ellos ayuda en el negocio, al separarse de su esposo ella se quedo con todo el gasto de la casa y la manutención de sus hijos y con lo que él le enviaba como pensión no cubrían los gastos, en esos momentos ella tomaba un tipo de leche en polvo y vio que podía venderla a sus conocidos, ella conoció esta leche debido a que una amiga la invito a probarla y como le hizo mucho bien entonces fue ahí cuando se intereso en venderla, así ella empezó a venderla entre sus familiares y vecinos, más adelante la vendió en fábricas cercanas a su domicilio, ya tiene más de año y medio con su negocio y gracias a el, ha podido sacar adelante a su familia pero desea poder continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

María solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para comprar mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes ya que le están solicitando mucho sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y sus hijos te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Meals in Murinaki are always delicious, thanks to the great tasting Unión brand products on the table. Elvira C. puts them there day after day without fail. She has worked selling these products for a long time, and this job has allowed her to pay for school; all of her hard work has allowed her to help her children and succeed in her studies. The upcoming Christmas season can be a great opportunity for Elvira, especially because of the increased demand for panetones, traditional holiday cakes, throughout the city. Therefore, she would like to bring a large number of them to the Murinaki community, and, with her characteristic friendliness, sell them. With this new group of products she will continue to help and support her children whom she loves so much. Reach out to this mother who studied to become a professional and now wants the same for her children. You can help.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Las comidas en Murinaki son placenteras y muy deliciosas todos los días, debido a la presencia de los deliciosos productos de la fabrica unión en las mesas, ya que Elvira C. se encarga de llevarlos infaltablemente día a día. Ella se dedica a la venta de estos productos desde hace mucho tiempo y le ha permitido solventar sus estudios como docente durante mucho tiempo y ahora con su desempeño puede ayudar a sus hijos, también en su superación académica.La próxima campaña navideña se deslumbra como una oportunidad muy grande para Elvira, debido a la gran demanda de panetones en la ciudad, por lo que desea traer una gran cantidad de estos a la pequeña comunidad de Murinaki y así con la misma amabilidad que la caracteriza desde siempre los comercializará.Con este nuevo grupo de productos seguirá ayudando y contribuyendo con sus hijos a quienes ama mucho.Ayudemos a esta madre que estudió para ser profesional y ahora desea lo mismo para sus hijos y usted puede ayudar.

loans.use: Puchase of panettones to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Suubilyamukama Lending Group

texts.en:
Aisha is the Chairperson for the Suubilyamukama Lending Group in the Lugazi Village. (Yes, I did double-check the name of the lending group, but I will leave it to you for the correct pronunciation.) Since Lugazi is in a very rural area, most of the members are in agriculture. Aisha is an exception. When I asked her what her business was she told me she was a “hawker”.

Once I understood what she was saying, I still had a problem with the word, since in my culture it is often deemed a business that has illegal connotations. But I did not want to change the word, since this is what she said, so let me clarify. A hawker is someone who sells there goods without the benefit of a fixed location. They therefore walk around busy markets and taxi parks carrying and selling their wares. Aisha sells used clothing. This is not an easy job and most would like to be able to afford to rent a store front. There are many hawkers on the streets and they are seen as just as respectable as storefront owners, though not as well off.

Aisha has been a hawker for two years and a member of her lending group for nine years, hence her position as chairperson. I got the feeling she has had a downturn in her life, but is determined to be able to rent a storefront. She is married and has three children. With her portion of the group loan, which is approximately $275 US, she plans to buy more used clothing to sell. The clothing is bought in Kampala and is bought in bags or bales. She is not allowed to see what is in the bags until after she purchases it, though she can determine if she wants t-shirts or shirts or skirts. There can be several hundred items in each bale.

loans.use: Aisha plans to use her loan to buy more bales of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She prints cotton clothes and sells them wholesale and retail. Her income is solely from her business and she would like to expand it.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $350.

loans.use: She would like to create additional Gara tye and dye materials to sell in the market

loans.name: Hikmatullo.

texts.ru:
Hikimatullo Z. is a resident of the city of Vahdat. He is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. He has a professional degree in woodworking. For the last four years Mr. Z. has been selling groceries at a store in Vahdat. He is planning to use the loan to increase the goods turnover in his store by expanding the selection of groceries he is offering. This loan will help support Mr. Z.'s grocery store and allow the locals to buy food in their own city at low prices. Mr. Z. is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Зарипов Хикматулло житель города Вахдат, возраст 39 лет.женат имеет 2 детей. Образование средне-специальное. По специальности плотник. Занимается торговлей продуктов питания. Имеет торговую точку в городе Вахдат . На запланированный кредит хочет увеличит товарооборот путем расширения ассортимента товара. Опыт в бизнесе 4 года. Этот бизнес дает возможность населению покупать товар в своем городе по доступным ценам Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Expanding selection of goods for sale

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory G. is married with six children. She is 43 years old and hails from Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in business selling goats since 1988. She needs a loan of $875 to buy more goats to sell.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asuncion started working as a laborer, working 12 hours a day, with the goal of making money to pay expenses for the birth of his son and then, sadly, for funeral expenses to bury the child who was born dead. While he was paying off the expenses, he made the decision to start his own business so that he could spend more time with his wife. Nine years ago, he began selling iced deserts and fresh fruit that to this day have provided him a good income and a way to pay for all he needs.

Asuncion is applying for a US$775 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to buy basic ingredients for his food business because he expects his sales to go up as the weather gets warmer over the coming months. He hopes that with Kiva's support, he'll get the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Asunción inicio trabajando como obrero cubriendo un horario de 12 horas, mantuvo este empleo con el fin de obtener mas ingresos para solventar gastos del nacimiento de su hijo y posteriormente los gastos funerarios, ya que desgraciadamente su hijo nació muerto. En la medida en que fue solventando todos sus gastos tomo la decisión de emprender su propio negocio y así estar más tiempo con su esposa. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de nieves y frutas que hasta hoy en día le ha dejado buenos ingresos y ha podido solventar todas sus necesidades.

Ahora esta solicitando de un crédito de US $775 a 6 meses, para la compra de materia prima ya que se acerca la temporada de calor que es cuando mas ventas genera. El tiene la esperanza que con el apoyo de Kiva lo obtendrá.

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients for food business.

loans.name: Rebecca Tida

texts.en: Mrs Rebecca Tida S. is a teacher in an orphanage school. She is  42 years old and married with four children. She has been teaching for the last 18 years but her income is insufficient to meet the family's expenses.  Although her husband works with and NGO on a contract basis, he earns meager income and the employment is unsustainable.  The family has no house of their own.  To diversify the family source of income, Rebecca started a business of selling agricultural products.  With little savings, she purchased rice, beans, palm oil and chili pepper and distributed to her customers during weekends and collected the income bi weekly.  When Rebecca heard about kiva program, she approached SMT and requested a loan of $700 to expand her business which she would be able to repay from her salary.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Yegane

texts.en: Yegane B. is 38 years old. She breeds calves for meat production in the Internally Displaced People Settlement of the Bilasuvar region. Married and with three sons, Yegane has bred calves for more than fifteen years. She applied for $800 US to purchase two calves for $300 US each and fodder with the remaining money.

loans.use: To purchase two calves and fodder

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim S. is a primary school teacher and a farmer. Her husband is a principle of another primary school. Their combined income is $4.80 per day which remains insufficient to support her family’s expenses sufficiently. Mrs. Yim needs to expand her farming business in order to increase her income. Therefore, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase a plot of farmland for her farming business. The loan will allow them to expand their farming business and help increase their family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Salama's Riziki Popote Group

texts.en:
Salama is 25 years,She is a married woman with 3 children aged 6, 4 and 1. Also take care of 1 other person aged 40 years old. She own a small shop since in february 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Salama has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Salama now hopes for a loan to buy more rice, flour, beans, and soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwajuma and Fadhila.

loans.use: To buy more food items and soap to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a 36-year-old entrepreneur and the mother of 2 school-aged children. She lives in Likoni, Mombasa, Kenya.  She began her current business of selling new clothes in 1995. She specializes in women's clothing: skirts, dresses, casual clothes, and bed sheets. She periodically travels to Nairobi and Kampala, Uganda, where she is able to purchase a good variety at wholesale prices. The prime location of her business is on a busy street; her 3 years of experience and her friendly interaction with customers have enabled her to establish a good client base. Roseline plans to expand her business with her next loan of US$800.

loans.use: To add a variety of new stock of clothes

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin is 34 years old and married to Mr. D., who is a welder, and they have three children. 

Toyin sells foodstuffs in wholesale and retail. Toyin is a LAPO client and she needs the loan amount of $925 to purchase more food products to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To add more products to her mini-market.

loans.name: Ehsonjon

texts.en: H. Ehsonjon is 39 years old. He and his wife had raised 3 children. For 13 years Ehsonjon is selling the flowers. His trading place is located in the central flower market of the city and he works from the early morning till the late night. Once in two weeks Ehsonjon travels to Uzbekistan, the neighboring country for purchasing the flowers. For the years of his work Ehsonjon became an expert in his business knowing even how to safe the flowers during severe winter. The business is successful generating the stable income for the family. Ehsonjon repaid his previous loan ahead of schedule and as now it is season time he wants to take another loan. He requests 4000 Somoni ($ 1000 USD) for the term of 10 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing the flowers for selling. Ehsonjon is the client of IMON for more than three years and having the positive credit history. He thanks all for supporting and promises to be precise in loan payment.

loans.use: Purchasing of the flowers for selling.

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr:
ce monsieur de vingt huit ans (28) vit dans le quartier protestant à Lomé. il a ouvert un bar dans lequel il vend des boissons et des liqueurs, son bar s’appelle « COIN CHAUD », il fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et au point d’approvisionnement de la brasserie du Bénin. il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de  WAGES  et sollicite son premier crédit pour s’approvisionner avec des cartons de liqueurs et de casiers de boissons.
il est marié mais n’a pas d’enfants.il pourra donc avec ce crédit s’entretenir et aider certains autres personnes de sa famille.
texts.en:
This young man of 28, lives in the Protestant district of Lomé. He has opened a little bar where he sells drinks and liquors. He calls his bar « COIN CHAUD » (Warm Corner), and he has been in this business since 2005. He does his buying in the big open-air market of Lomé and at the Bénin Brewery store. He has never had a loan from WAGES and is asking for his first in order to buy cases of liquors and crates of drinks.

He is married but has no children. With this loan, he will thus be able to support himself and help certain other members of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks

loans.name: Ni Putu Suantini

texts.id:
Dari pengalaman yang dialami setelah bergabung dengan Yayasan DINARI melalui pinjaman yang diperoleh pada periode terdahulu, Ni Putu Suantini sudah mempunyai dua ekor induk, Maka untuk pinjaman kedua, akan dipergunakan membeli satu ekor lagi dan selebihnya untuk persiapan membeli pakan ternaknya. Untuk menambah jumlah ternaknya Ni Putu Suantini membeli satu babi penggemukan yang sudah siap menjadi calon induk lagi jenis Landrace.

Penggembangan usaha ternak ini dilakukan dengan harapan penghasilan yang didapat tidak menunggu sampai enam bulan, tetapi penghasilan dari menjual bibit babi bisa dilakukan setiap bulan sehingga dapat membantu penghasilan Made Warsanto, suaminya. Saat ini Putu Suantini  tinggal bersama Made Warsanto suaminya dan anaknya terakhirnya yang masih sekolah ditingkat dasar. Sedang anaknya pertama  pertama dan kedua  sekolah di tingkat atas diluar daerah. Dari hasil ternak inilah keluarga ini dapat memenuhi keperluan anak-anaknya yang masih sekolah. Penghasilan bersih dalam setiap dua sampai tiga bulan dapat mencapai Rp.600.000,- Harapan kedepannya usaha ternak dapat berkembang sehingga hasilnya dapat mencukupi keperluan keluarganya.
texts.en:
Ni Putu Suantini participated with DINARI foundation loan program in the past. She is now able to own two breeding pigs. She is now planning to participate in another program and she wants to use the money to buy another breeding pig and also to buy pig foods. She is going to buy a breeding pig from a Landrace variant.

Ni Putu is living with her husband, Made Warsanto, and their 3rd child who is still in Elementary school. Their first two children are already in Senior High school outside the town. Ni Putu and her husband use the proceed from this pig farming to finance the education of their children. She can earn IDR 600 thousand (around USD 57) in a 2 - 3 month period.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a piglet and it's feed

loans.name: Risky

texts.en:
Risky A. is 45 years old. She’s married with two children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 12 years she has been purchasing young sheep and calves in the local market, fattening and selling them.

Risky is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income to her home. Risky wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. She started this occupation because of the recommendation and teaching of her beloved mother.

Thanks to this activity Risky is offering her children an education. Risky wants to keep educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 800 USD to buy calves in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to fatten for sale

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en: Evalyne O. Owuor is a 35-year-old mother of 6 girls, aged 6-20. She sells fish from a stall in the Kasagam area in Kisumu, Kenya. The profit will serve as an additional source of income for her large family. Her husband also works as a carpenter, though times are tough. She will use the funds to continue to grow her business. Evalyne is proud to be working for her family.

loans.use: The purchase of more fish for re-sale

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio.
Honorata es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Honorata se dedica a la crianza D. animales como gallinas, cerdos, actividad que realiza en su casa, los animales los venD. en los diferentes mercados.
Honorata necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte D. pago D. una computadora.
Los sueños D. Honorata son mejorar su casa e implementar una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Honorata is a member of Communal Bank Lirio. Honorata is married, 50 years old, and has 5 children. Honorata dedicates herself to raising animals such as chickens and pigs; she carries out this activity at her house, and then sells the animals in different markets. Honorata needs a loan of 1000 PEN, money that will be invested as part of a payment for a computer. Honorata’s dreams are to improve her house, and to open a shop in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: As part of a payment for a computer for her children.

loans.name: Cecilia De

texts.es: Cecilia de 58 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijas mayores, que ya son independientes, dos de ellas se encuentran en España y la otra acá en el país. La vivienda donde vive Cecilia es propia. Cecilia se dedica al comercio de ropa usada, también tiene venta de comida y su esposo recibe renta de jubilado. Tiene bastante experiencia en este negocio, la competencia es media, el crédito es para construcción, ella ha tenido un buen comportamiento crediticio, además ha tenido 5 créditos en agrocapital con buen comportamiento crediticio.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 58 years old, married, and has 3 grown children who are now living independently; two are in Spain, and the third is still here in the country. The house where Cecilia lives is her own. Cecilia dedicates herself to selling used clothing as well as food, and her husband receives a retirement pension. She has a great deal of experience in her business, within which there is some competition. The loan funds are for construction use, and her credit history is good. She has had five loans with Agrocapital, all of which she has undertaken in a responsible manner.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home repairs.

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou B. est un jeune tailleur marié qui est âgé de 32 ans et a deux femmes et des enfants. Il habite au quartier Grand Thiès et a son propre atelier de tailleur depuis 6 ans. Son activité consiste à travailler sur commande  et a des clients à l’extérieur (France et USA). Avec ce prêt il veut acheter des tissus qu’il confectionne pour les revendre. Après la vente il espère d’avoir un bénéfice de 90,250 CFA ($180) avec lequel il pourra rembourser les intérêts de son prêt et le reste il va l’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou B. is a young married tailor who is 32 years old. He has a wife and children and lives in the Grand Thiès district. He has had his own workshop for six years. His work involves working by special order, and he has foreign customers (France and U.S.A.). With this loan, he wants to buy fabrics for making clothing to sell. He then hopes to earn a profit of 90,250 francs CFA, which he will be able to use to make loan interest payments and to invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is currently selling coffee, powdered milk, sugar, etc at her shop and is requesting a loan to open up a restaurant in order to expand her business. She is a 24 year old woman whose husband is a business man. She has three children and two attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a resturant

loans.name: Djidja 2. 2 (Soyez Courageux). Group

texts.fr:
Djidja 2 .2 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village  Siguémona de la ville de Koutiala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs enfants, maris, beaux parents, belles sœurs  etc. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et au moins 6 enfants.
Elles cultivent  principalement  du riz et  de l’arachide comme activité Secondaire.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  Djidja 2 .2 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans. Après avoir correctement remboursés  les trois  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur quatrième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter,  des semences de riz,  d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture,  au marché de Zansoni, M’pessoba et de Fonfona. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au  marché de M’pessoba et  de Koutiala, en détail ou en gros au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Djidja 2. 2 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 85 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Djidja 2. 2 is a group of married women from the village of Siguémona, town of Koutiala (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in big traditional extended families with their children, husbands, parents-in-law, sisters-in-law, etc. They have an average age of 45 and at least 6 children. They cultivate principally rice, with peanuts as a secondary crop.

With the intention of making their agricultural businesses profitable, the members of the Djidja 2 .2 group decided to join the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After having correctly reimbursed the three preceding loans, they are on their fourth rural loan.

This loan will be used to buy rice seedlings, peanut seeds, minor material and intrants for their crops at the markets of Zansoni, M’pessoba, and Fonfona. After the rainy season, the harvests are stockpiled for a certain time so that they gain in value before being sold at the market of M’pessoba and of Koutiala, retail and wholesale, for cash, to a clientele generally coming from the big cities.

Each of the members of the Djidja 2 .2 group expects to make, after their crops have been sold, a profit of 85,000 F CFA which will be used to reimburse the loan and for current family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of intrants, seeds, and minor agricultural materials

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma T. is from Brgy, Pandan Gingoog City. She is 34 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Erma makes and sells food. Her main source of income comes from selling specialty foods like "binangkal" (a homemade Filipino bread) in the local community. Erma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Erma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to support the education of her children. ------------------------------------- About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Buy raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

location.town: Barangay 25, Pandan, Gingoog City, Mis. Or.

loans.name: Nairar Sarantañani Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “Alto Lima” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Nairar Sarantañani” que significa “Iremos adelante”, cuenta con 13 integrantes que  se caracterizan por comunicarse en su mayoría con el idioma “aymara” (idioma nativo), explican que tienen negocios pequeños y necesitan el préstamo para aumentar su capital D. trabajo, algunas venden maní, fierros, abarrote, tienda D. barrio y la mayoría venD. ropa (Ejemplo: chamarras, matillas, pantalones y otros)  en diferentes ferias D. la ciudad D. El Alto. Su presidenta es Maria Paz y menciona que les gusta reunirse para compartir e intercambiar ideas D. como mejorar sus negocios, además se sienten muy orgullosas porque muchas D. ellas han levantado sus negocios solas, por la necesidad D. darles alimento, vestimenta y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Nairar Sarantañani Association, whose name means We Will Go Forward, is found in the Alto Lima Center. It is maD. up of 13 members who speak mainly Aymara, a native langauge. They have small businesses and need the loan to increase their working capital. Some of them sell peanuts, tools, and groceries and the majority sell clothing (for example: jackets, head scarves, and other items) at different markets in the city of El Alto. The group's president is Maria Paz and she mentions that the group likes to get together to share ideas about how to improve their businesses and that they feel proud because many have started their businesses on their own due to the need to proviD. food, clothing and education to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Lann

texts.en:
Lann is a 47-year-old mother of six children, four of whom are married and have already started new homes. The others are still attending school. She currently stays at home to plant a few vegetables for sale. Her husband owns a small garage which he uses to provide a vehicle washing service, and is earning around $8 each day. The family depends on this income to meet their daily expenses. Lann’s husband says that he can attract many regular customers, but is hampered by the fact that his work space is too small and overcrowded. Lann requested a loan in order to get a larger garage, which will permit better service.

Note: Lann was not available for photographing, so her husband appears in the photo instead.

loans.use: To get a larger garage for better service

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
In the city of Quiindy in the Bernardino C. neighborhood 23 km from the Carapeguá office, some women with limited resources that joined into the Mujeres Emprendedoras committee and decided to get together to receive information about the program mentioned.  

These active women, the majority of them dedicated to selling things and other activities mentioned above.  They are looking for a little more support to strengthen their families´ incomes and to better the quality of their lives through credit.  

They need this loan to invest in their respective jobs and with this they can attain sustainable growth that they will help them to grow as a group and as individuals. 

Some of the activities are: sale of milk, cheese, clothes,crafts, grocery store, dressmaker, etc.

loans.use: to invest in their respective jobs

loans.name: Bayardo Javier

texts.es: Este joven emprendedor Bayardo Javier Méndez Hernández tiene 30 años. Es casado y tiene 2 hijos. Su actividad económica es la venta de productos de medicina natural. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, el inicio con muy pocos productos, ya que no tenía el suficiente capital para comprar muchas medicinas, además Bayardo tenía que vender su medicina de manera ambulante en los buses y por medio de un amigo que le facilitó el dinero logro salir adelante y de esta forma obtuvo muchos beneficios. El recurre a Fundación León 2000 para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de productos. Su deseo es seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que no pasen lo mismo que el.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Dawa

texts.en: Dawa M. is currently in the business of selling bread and beans and is requesting a loan to stock more beans to sell.  Dawa is 39 years old and is Married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school.
