She is married to Baleng, who is an employee of Air Zaire, and they are raising 5 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Ith

texts.en: Mrs. Ith H. is a 41-year-old widow who lives in Tadork Pong village in Takeo province. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase a cow for breeding and for plowing the field for cultivation. Mrs. Ith H. is the mother of three children, two of whom are construction workers while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding and for plowing her field for cultivation.

loans.name: Caroline's Group

texts.en:
Caroline B. is one of the executive members of her lending group in Mityana. She is a married lady and trained to run a clinic, which is her business. She treats people and sells medicine to her patients. Her clients like this type of health service because there is a personal touch attached when you visit a private clinic as compared to the big Government hospitals. This is why trained clinicians like Caroline are in business. She offers over the counter health services as well as providing first aid and minor surgeries. Caroline treats her patients well. 

Caroline is requesting a loan to help stock her clinic with medicines like tablets, syrups, cotton wool, syringes, needles, so that she can earn a reasonable profit from her business.

loans.use: To buy medicines like tablets, syrups, cotton wool, syringes,and needles .

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel sells ice cream retail to his customers. He has a bicycle that he uses to hawk his ice cream within his community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He hopes for the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more ice cream to sell. He is 40 years old and married with a child. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Santos Marivel

texts.es:
La señora Santos Marivel C. García tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijos los cuales dependen económicamente de ella.
Santos empezó con Manuela Ramos, en la venta de cerveza y así con el capital que se generaba poco a poco fue surtiendo su tienda de abarrotes, el negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles, que recibió de su Banco “Comunal Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, lo invirtió en la compra de abarrotes para poder competir con los demás negocios ubicados a su alrededor.
Con el crédito de 500 soles , que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina y abarrotes al por mayor para equipar su negocio.
Santos tiene como sueño, viajar con su familia disfrutar del bienestar de su familia y la prosperidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Santos Marivel C. García is 34 years old and lives in the Salaverry district, province of Trujillo, in La Libertad. She completed her secondary school studies, and has 2 children who depend on her financially. Santos started with Manuela Ramos in the sale of beer; with the capital from this endeavor she slowly was able to supply her grocery store, which she runs out of her home. With the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Triunfadoras de Salaverry II”, she invested in the purchase of groceries so she could compete with the other businesses around her. With the loan of 500.00 soles, to be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of a display case and groceries at wholesale for her store. Santos’ dreams include traveling with her family, and enjoying the family’s well-being and the prosperity of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a display case and groceries at wholesale for her store.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en: Mrs. Meryn R. is 32 years old, married and lives at Poblacion, Oroquieta City. She has 2 children. Her husband is a government employee but receives only a minimum wage rate. All her children are sent to private schools. In this case, she has to have an extra income for the coming school year. She decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative last August 2008 to avail its loan facilities. They started a business buying and selling firewood after their wedding day. The initial capital was a gift from their parents. Today, she applies for PHP 7,000 to buy additional firewood, goods and electronic load for “sari-sari” (general) store. She’s hopeful that she will be able to send all her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional goods/utilities for a general store

loans.name: Ekuwa

texts.en:
Ekuwa T. is married with 6 dependents and has received no formal education. Since 2001 she has worked as a trader, selling foodstuffs in Ankwanda near Elmina. While Ekuwa works as a trader, her husband is employed as a fisherman. Ekuwa uses her income to pay for her family’s school fees and light bill.

She will use the loan to purchase maize, gari and fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekuwa plans to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Umarboy

texts.ru: Усмонов Умарбой 1951 года рождения , женат имеет 3 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Сотрудничает с Микроинвест 2005 года. Торгует рисом на рынке. Частично также работает в государственном предприятии водного хозяйства. Но изза низкого оклада занялся бизнесом в 5 лет назад. Узнал о кредите Микроинвест от друзей и родственников и решил получть также кредит и сейчас благодаря кредиту от КИВА улучшил свое положение и рад этому.
texts.en:
Umarboy U. was born in 1951, married, and has 3 children. He has a high school education. Umarboy has been working with MicroInvest since 2005. He sells rice at a local market. Umarboy U. also works at a state water supply management organization, but his pay there is low. To supplement his income, Umarboy started his rice selling business 5 years ago. Umarboy learned about MicroInvest and Kiva loan programs from his friends and relatives. The previous loans helped Umarboy improve his life quality and expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: La señora Josefa León de 55 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene cinco hijos tres mayores de edad y dos estudian, es soltera y su negocio es la venta de fritanga y una pequeña pulpería que administra desde hace seis años, este negocio lo inicio con ahorros y es su sexto crédito en Afodenic y lo va invertir en la compra de granos básicos como: frijoles, arroz, productos lácteos, para incrementar su inventario y elevar las ventas. Los planes para su familia es poder hacer mejoras a su vivienda ya que es sencilla e insegura por que parte de la vivienda esta forrada de zinc y desea dejar a sus hijos una casa digna.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa L. is 55 years old, single and lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliacion. She has five children three of them are adults and two are students. Her business is the sale of fried meals and a grocery shop that she has managed for six years, which she started with her savings.

This is her sixth loan with Afodenic. She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains such as beans, rice and dairy products, to increase her inventory and sales. She hopes to be able to make improvements in her house because it is basic and unsafe since part of it is lined with zinc. She wants to give a decent home to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Saifullo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Муллажонов Сайфулло -молодой человек 31-го года ,женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Сайфулло- старший сын в семье и поэтому, чтобы помочь своим родителям решил заняться откормом и купля-продажей скота.Он имеет опыт в сфере животновдства, так  как помогал своему отцу откармливать крупно-рогатый скот. На полученный кредит он расчитывает купить дойную корову, чтобы иметь дополнительный доход для своей семьи. В этом ему будет помогать его жена Салимова Мухайё.Кроме того он работает  маляром в автотехстанции
texts.en:
Saifullo M. is a young, 31-year-old man. He is married and has a child. Saifullo is the oldest son in his family and decided to become involved in livestock feeding and sales in order to help his parents. He has experience in the animal husbandry field because he used to help his father feed cattle. He wants to use this loan to buy a dairy cow and have an additional source of income for his family. His wife, Muhaiyo Salimova, will be helping him with the business. Saifullo also works as a painter at an auto shop.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Petrona De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Petrona de Los Angeles Q. Torres.  Tiene la edad de 42 años el negocio de la señora consiste en una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que es una mujer muy responsable y disfruta mucho de su trabajo. Tiene un varón de 7 años su compañero de vida está fuera del país, por lo que la crianza de su hijo, solamente le corresponde a ella. El negocio de ella consiste en una pulpería que está ubicada en su casa de habitación tiene además de mantener este negocio, Petrona imparte clases en colegio muy humilde de su comunidad. En la actualidad ella ya ha realizado 2 financiamientos en fundación LEON 2000 para la pulpería. La señora Petrona aspira mantener su negocio y lograr tener más recursos para mantener con varios productos en su negocio y de esta manera ayudarse para la crianza de su hijo ya que ella es madre soltera y su pareja no la ayuda económicamente a su hijo.
texts.en:
Petrona de Los Angeles Q. Torres is 42 years old, and she runs a small grocery store. She has dedicated herself to this business for over 5 years; she is a very responsible woman and enjoys her work very much. She has a 7-year-old son, and her life partner is currently outside the country, because of this she is solely responsible for raising her son. Her small grocery store is located in her house and in addition to maintaining this business she also gives classes in a humble school in her community. Currently she has had 2 loans through the LEON 2000 Foundation, which she invested in her grocery store. Petrona hopes to maintain her business and to be able to have more resources available to her to be able to carry various products in her business; in this way she will be able to help herself in raising he son given that she is a single mother and her partner does not help financially with her son.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: Kichangani Group

texts.en:
Witnes is a member of the Kichangani borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 30-year-old woman, is married, and is the mother of two children aged 7 years and 1 year old. She also cares for two other dependents.

Three years ago, Witnes started her own business selling food. She works six hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 200,000 Tanzania Shillings.

This is Witnes’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice and wheat. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, she hopes to save money and expand her business. 

Aisha, Ashura, Mwajabu and Rehema are the other members of the Kichangani borrower group. They requested 150,000 Tsh each in order to support their own businesses.

loans.use: To buy more rice and wheat

loans.name: Chimène

texts.fr: Chimène est née le 21/11/1980 à Adjohoun au Sud du Bénin. Chimène est mariée à ZINSOU Armand ; ils ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Chimène et sa famille vivent à Cotonou depuis huit ans. C’est Chimène et son mari qui supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Chimène vend chez elle à la maison dans une boutique qu’elle a ouverte à cet effet, des poissons, poulets, saucisses et ailerons congelés. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Chimène s’approvisionne en tous ces produits. Chimène a un an d’expérience dans cette activité. Chimène est à son quatrième crédit avec ALIDé. Chimène est un bon client qui rembourse bien ses prêts. Chimène sollicite ce prêt-ci pour diversifier son activité à la vente des œufs et huile végétale.

loans.use: Achat de cartons de poissons congelés, des œufs et de bidons d’huile végétale.

loans.name: Karen Lisseh

texts.es: Karen Lisseh G. C.  reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Karen tiene 26 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo Ernesto de 3 años de edad. Karen posee un pequeño negocio de venta de comida típica desde su casa, donde todos los días monta sus mesas con variedad de productos, a la vista de las personas. Karen tiene una buena clientela, no posee competencia en la zona; ahora solita un crédito para la compra de materia prima que le permita aumentar la producción de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Karen Lisseh G. C. lives in Arce City in the district of La Libertad. She is 26 years old, married, and has a 3 year old son named Ernesto.

Karen has a small business selling traditional foods from her home, where she sets up tables with a variety of dishes in view of people who pass through her neighborhood. She has a good client base and does not have any competitors in her area. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients so that she can increase her production and offer more dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients used in her dishes

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is married with four children. His wife doesn't work and so his bookstore is the only source of income for the family.

Mohammad started this bookstore with 500 USD capital eight years ago as a small kiosk at the entrance to a school.  Now he has a good bookstore where he sells books, copy books, office tools, and also gifts and accessories.

Mohammad requested the loan to meet the demand of schools that request a lot of photocopying of documents. He wants to buy a photocopier with the loan.

Mohammad appears in the photo at the entrance to his bookstore and, in the small inset photos, inside his shop.

loans.use: To purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Anthony A Nkalubo Harriet Group

texts.en: N. Harriet is a hard working business woman of forty years old, married with three children of whom two are going to school and she has six dependents schooling too. She owns rental houses since the year 2003. She is requesting for the loan to purchase paint, cement for renovating her rental houses. This rental houses are playing a big role in helping her family mostly in educating the children, feeding the family and so forth. In addition to that, she is selling water to community members helping her as side business too. Her dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase paint, cement for renovating her rental houses.

loans.name: Zarif

texts.ru: Хайруллоев Зариф проживает в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 39 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Зариф более 10 лет работает по специальности "механиком". Вот более 4 лет начал заниматся животноводством. Он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для покупки крупно рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Zarif H. lives in the Abdurahmon-Jomi region. He is 39 years old. He is married and has six children. Zarif has worked as a mechanic for more than ten years. As of four years ago he started doing animal husbandry. He feeds and sells cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Nena

texts.en: Nena O. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old, is separated from her spouse, and has three adult children. Nena owns and operates a business providing tricycle transport in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Nena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,500 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase an additional tricycle. Nena is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used purchase an additional tricycle. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional tricycle again

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.en:
Zafarjon S. is 37 years old, married and has 6 children. He has a secondary education and has an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow house where he breeds calves.

Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. Zafarjon buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them on the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the markets with meat and his family with the necessary food.

Zafarjon wants to buy more cattle and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan of 1500 USD.

Due to the profitability of his business, the determination of this micro entrepreneur, and his experience in the business, this customer is qualified to receive this loan.

Your support will really help him. Zafarjon is counting on your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand his business.

loans.name: Unurjargal

texts.en:
B. Unurjargal is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a "ger". Both his young son and daughter attend kindergarten. Unurjargal has operated a taxi service in his town since 2004. He transports people around his town as well as to different areas throughout Hovd province. He has gained much experience over the years and is a trusted driver for his many customers. Unurjargal is a very hardworking person and is known for his good character. He is working hard to maintain his success and has much hope for the future. He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan to purchase parts for his taxi. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase parts for his taxi

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie T., 51, is a rice farmer. She has four adult children. She is seeking additional capital for her business so that she will be able to have an abundant harvest to buy her family an adequate supply of food, clothing and other basic needs. 

She is hoping to receive a loan of 10,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow her crops well.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en: Mrs. Sokun K. lives in Chambok village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who earns a small income to help support her family. She now wants to expand her business so she decided to request a loan to buy more groceries to resell. Her husband, Mr. Sey Cheam, is an electrician. Mrs. Sokun K. is a mother of three children who are all students.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. S., 38, is married to Dara, age 49. They both are parents who are blessed with two children who are going to school and dependent on them. Presently S. and her husband depend on income from their annual business whose the main activity is to cultivate various vegetable and fruit crops, which she will harvest and sell to buyers when they are matured. Recently S. doesn’t have enough capital to perform in her crop-planting business, so she decided to look a loan of US $500, and she will buy fertilizers and watermelon seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and watermelon seeds to grow.

loans.name: Lon

texts.en: Mrs. Lon U. lives in Phngeas village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare field where she cultivates rice. She now has a problem because the soil in her field is infertile. She decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to improve the field. She will use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides to kill insects. Her husband, Mr. Non Chhaem, breeds cows. Mrs. Lon U. is the mother of five children, one of whom works in a garment factory. The other three are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve her land and to buy pesticides

loans.name: Icyubahiro Group

texts.en:
Assia is 32 years old and she is single.  Assia is the president of a group called 'Icyubahiro'.  This group consists of 3 people who operate businesses selling clothes in Rwamagana, a region of Kibungo situated in the eastern province of Rwanda.  This is their 6th successful year in this business and the hours of their business are from 8 AM until 6PM every day.

Assia and her team are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their businesses through purchasing a variety of clothing styles (for babies and children, men and women).  With this business expansion, this group hopes to attract more customers as well as increase sales.  If this is successful, Assia and her team will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow them to reinvest in their business in order to keep the progress of their business as well as building a secure future for each member's family.

loans.use: Additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La Señora Reyna Isabel tiene 44 años, Tiene 3 hijos y estudian para ser muy buenos profesionales. La actividad económica de Reyna es brindar el servicio de Gimnasio, hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella inicio por sus hijos que le ayudaron y poyaron con esta idea, pues no tiene mucha competencia y ella se preocupa por proporcionarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Es por eso que solicito ayuda a Fundación León 2000 con el fin de comprar ciertas maquinas y reparar ciertos equipos. Sus deseos son de ampliar su establecimiento para obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Reyna Isabel is 44 years old. Her three children study at school so they will have good professions. For more than 3 years now, Reyna has run a small gym. She started this business with the help of her children. They don't have a lot of competition, and Reyna worries about managing all of the clients who come to her. She is requesting a loan to purchase new machines and repair equipment. She would like to grow her establishment and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her small gym and grow her income by purchasing new machines and making repairs

loans.name: Sourou Monique

texts.fr: G. Sourou Monique est née vers 1955 et vit depuis huit ans au quartier Missessin à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à KATADJO Cyprien, Sourou Monique est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Le couple assure ensemble les charges familiales. Sourou Monique n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Il y a trois ans, en vue de contribuer à assurer les dépenses familiales, Sourou Monique a commencé la vente de nourriture (riz, accompagnée de sauce de tomate) à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Sourou Monique vend de l'huile d'arachide. Sourou Monique s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Face à la demande un peu plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Sourou Monique souhaite augmenter sa production alimentaire et son stock d'huile, afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle et de se faire plus de revenu. C'est ce qui l'amène à solliciter un quatrième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sourou Monique G. was born around 1955 and has lived for the past eight years in the Missessin district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Cyprien KATADJO, Sourou Monique is mother to one child who is at school. The couple covers the family expenses together. Sourou Monique attended primary school only. In order to contribute towards family expenses, Sourou Monique began three years ago to sell food (rice accompanied by tomato sauce) from her home. At the same time, she sells peanut oil. Sourou Monique gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. She is an old customer of ALIDé who repays her loans correctly. Faced with modestly increasing demand from her customers, Sourou Monique would like to increase her production of food and her stock of oil, in order satisfy better her customers' needs and to make more money. For this reason she is applying for a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cans of oil and bags of rice

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal U. and her husband, Mr. Leang Seak, have been married since 1990 and have one daughter who is in school. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sophal has been selling food and rice for more than two years. Her husband has been driving a taxi for more than ten years as well, but his taxi breaks down and does not work well.

Hence, Sophal is asking for her second loan of $1,000 to repair her husband’s taxi. She will also use a part of her loan to put an addition on her house.

loans.use: To repair her husband’s taxi and put an addition on her house

loans.name: Malou

texts.en:
Malou R. is from the village of Maribucao, Gingoog City. She is 25 years old, married and has 2 infants. Malou owns & operates a business selling clothes to the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2009, Malou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Malou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to increase her working capital. Malou is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more ready-to-wear clothes to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Malou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en: Katerina, a married mother of three grown children, owns a greenhouse business that grows cucumbers, tomatoes and other vegetables. Not afraid of hard work, she has been in this business all of her adult life, her large family requiring lots of provision.  Katerina now needs to borrow 7,000 UAH to purchase fertilizers and film for the green houses. This will allow her to grow abundant crops on time and sell them at a better price.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and film for green house

loans.name: Mbula

texts.en:
Mbula is a married woman with four children, 3 girls and 1 boy. They all attend school. Her spouse sells spare parts. Sarah operates a grocery and also sells paraffin fuel. She hopes to buy more vegetables for her grocery and also buy five-20 litre containers of paraffin. She has been in the business for 5 years and previously was unemployed. She sells her products to her neighbors. She obtains other income from farming.

Her greatest business challenges are seasonality as she experiences low customer turn up during rainy seasons. She hopes to open a shop in the future. 
		
She decided to join Yehu after she saw other women benefiting from loans. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and  five-20 litre containers of paraffin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Plowing and buying manure and seeds

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en:
Nhan T. N. was born in 1977 and lives in Khu5 village. She has three children (two sons and one daughter).

Nhan T. N. and her husband sell building materials. They have a truck and her husband is a truck driver. They have a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND).

This is the first time Nhan T. N. has participated in SEDA. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to expand her building materials shop.

loans.use: To expand her building materials shop

loans.name: Agueda

texts.es: Agueda tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en su casa, que gracias a mucho esfuerzo lograron adquirir. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de ropa, siendo estas adquiridas en el mercado central de su ciudad y a un menor precio. Su forma de trabajo consiste en visitar a sus amistades y vecinos a ofrecer estos productos. El buen gusto que tiene Agueda para conseguir las prendas le ha dado mucha ventaja ante sus clientes, de esa manera logra vender con rapidez toda su mercadería. Ella se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza, pues le es rentable, ya que el acceso a la zona en la que vive es complicado, es por ello que sus vecinas no pueden ir por sus propios medios a comprar ropa. Es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete de a ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, quiere comprar mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para así mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Agueda is 28 years old. She lives together with her husband and son in her house that they were able to acquire thanks to much effort. The business in which she works is clothing sales, which she acquires in the central market of her city and at a lower price. Her method of work consists of visiting her friends and neighbors to sell these products. Agueda’s good taste for getting clothing has given her a great advantage with her customers and she is able to sell all of her merchandise quickly. She feels very pleased with the work that she does and it is profitable since the access that the area in which she lives has is complex. As a result, her neighbors cannot go by their own means to purchase clothing. This is her second loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of her payments. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more clothing to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire more items of clothing.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto D. S., aged 43, and his wife Hernani, are blessed in their marriage with a happy family. They live in Sabutan, Silang, Cavite. Modesto and his wife run a small fruit stand that sells pineapple, bananas and corn among other items, and which generates 18,000 PHP per month in earnings.
Modesto would like to expand his business with a loan of 10,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase additional varieties of fruit to meet the demands of his customers. He hopes that the additional variety will allow him to generate more revenue and increase the family's savings. Modesto hopes that eventually the business will generate enough revenue to allow him and his wife to have and support children.
Modesto has been a member of Kiva partner, the Center for Community Transformation (CCT), since 2005 and has consistently paid his weekly dues during fellowship meetings* . He is currently on his 12th loan with CCT. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. They gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional fruits to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is from the city of Prenza, Tangub City. She is 48 years old. Virginia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns & operates a business selling a variety of different products like toothpaste and drinks in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Virginia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Virginia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria Y. is from the village of Magsaysay, Baliangao. She is 56 years old, married, and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she grows and sells rice. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $113 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Eleuteria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Eleuteria is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a parcel of land. This will be her 14th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a parcel of land

loans.name: Shalom: Dios Con Nosotros Group

texts.es: La señora Olga tiene 49 años y es la secretaria del grupo “Shalom” que significa Dios con nosotros, los 8 miembros del grupo viven en Huaycan. Olga venD. ropa junto a su pareja, por este trabajo y los ahorros que ah acumulado ha enviado a sus dos hijas a la Argentina para que puedan prosperar por su parte, por su lado ella desea poner una galería D. venta D. ropas y para esto desea que Edaprospo aumente su capacidad D. Credito.
texts.en:
Olga, age 49, is secretary of the “Shalom” group. "Shalom" means God. The eight members of the group live in Huaycan. Olga and her life partner sell clothes together. With this work and the savings they gathered they have sent their two daughters to Argentina so that they are able to prosper. Olga wishes to establish a gallery selling clothes. In order to do so she wants Edaprospo to increase her loan limit.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose K. is 49 years old and is married; her husband is a tailor. She has seven children, four of whom go to school.

Rose currently sells clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more inventory to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Candida Azucena

texts.es:
Candida Azucena tiene  2 hijos, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años es una mujer muy activa que disfruta de su actividad.
Realizar este tipo de actividad de manera ambulante ha sido muy satisfactorio es la mejor manera para conseguir clientes nuevos. Ella se encarga de preparar su bolso para mostrar a sus clientes la variedad de cosméticos que ofrece  Candida solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos, los cuales son la materia prima para su negocio. Todo esto lo hace con el deseo de poder mejorar sus ventas y de esta manera contribuir con los gastos del hogar, y brindarle todo lo que sus hijos necesitan como alimentación ropa y hogar.
texts.en: Candida Azucena has 2 children and she sells cosmetics. For more than 3 years she has been a very active woman who enjoys her business. This type of activity as a street vender has been very successful and it is the best way to acquire new customers. She is responsible for preparing her bag to show customers the variety of cosmetics she offers. Candida is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products, which are the raw material for her business.  All of this is done with the desire to improve her sales and contribute to the household expenses and provide everything her children need such as clothing and a home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mary Obaa Yaa

texts.en: Mary Obaa Yaa A. cooks several varieties of food for sale at Abura. Mary has received junior high education. She is married and has seven dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs to cook to meet the request of her customers. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: buy more foodstuffs to cook

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 32 años, es una hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su hija Karol de 2 años y lo que más desea es brindarle un mejor futuro y por ellos esta dispuesto a trabajar muy duro. Cuando era niño, sus padres le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres, ya que sus hermanos mayores decidieron dedicarse a otras actividades. Ahora tiene extensas tierras para sembrar cacao y hojas de coca, que luego de ser cosechados son vendidos en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar, pues sabes que gracias a esta actividad puede sustentar a su familia. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus productos de la plaga de insectos. Ahora su propósito es comprarse nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará semillas de cacao y hojas de coca, así también comprará fertilizantes para asegurar la productividad de sus frutos.
texts.en: Edgar is 32 years old and a simple and hard-working man.  He lives at his parents' house, along with his daughter, Karol, of 2 years old.  Above all, he wishes to offer her a better future and for that he is willing to working very hard.  When he was a child, his parents taught him everything he needed to know about their small farm and little by little with the passing of time, he began to become in charge of his parents' land, since his older siblings decided to dedicate themselves to other professions.  Nowadays, he has an extensive amount of land to plant cacao and coco leaves.  After they are harvested, they are sold in the city of San Francisco.  What he enjoys most about his job is the cultivation because he knows that, luckily, with this activity he can support his family.  He has spent the past 15 years working in agriculture and the most challenging part of it has been protecting his plants from pesticides.  His objective is to purchase new land to increase his cultivations.  This is his first credit with MFP and plans to be very punctual with his payments.  In his communal bank, he is a very supportive member of the rest of his group.  With the 1,000 Soles that he is applying for, he will purchase cacao seeds and coco leaves, in addition to fertilizers in order to assure the results of his hard work.

loans.use: Purchase cacao seeds, coco leaves, and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a father of four, aged between twelve and four.  He has been doing mixed  farming for over five years in his hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya.  He produces tomatoes, vegetables, and milk.

He requested this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow.  He is optimistic the dairy product will give his family better living standards and educate his children.  He says he is focusing on expanding his farm to make the dairy business his source of livelihood.

He reiterates the fact that animal diseases are the greatest challenges.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Kadzo Karisa

texts.en: Kadzo Karisa K. is 35 years old. She is married to Karisa K. who is a civil servant. Kadzo supports five people. She has been in the tailoring business for the last three years. This will be her second loan from KADET LTD. Kadzo plans to purchase a new sewing machine and add to her stock of fabric for making dresses for sale. From the anticipated profits, she hopes to start a training school. Her dream is to own a tailoring training college and provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine and add to her stock of fabric for her business

loans.name: Rosas Blancas De Otzolotepec Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama “ROSAS BLANCAS D. OTZOLOTEPEC”,  se encuentra ubicado en Estado D. México y ésta compuesto por 10 integrantes. En este grupo se encuentra la señora Oralia C. D. 33 años D. edad, ella tiene 4 hijos y nos platica que estudió solamente la primaria. Oralia es comerciante, tiene un negocio D. herrería junto con su esposo, desD. hace aproximadamente 3 años, con el crédito quiere comprar materia prima para el crecimiento D. su negocio ya que así podrán surtir un número mayor D. pedidos.  A futuro quieren que su taller sea más granD. para producir más y contratar personal que les ayuD., así mismo desean adquirir un vehículo para la entrega D. pedidos a domicilio.
texts.en: This group is called Rosas Blancas D. Otzolotepec.  It is located in the State of México and consists of ten members.  Oralia C. is in this group and she is 33 years old.  She has four children and tells us that she only completed elementary school.  Oralia is a merchant and she has had a blacksmith business with her husband for approximately three years.  With the loan, she wants to purchase raw material for her business’ growth so that they will be able to fill a larger number of orders.  In the future, they want their workshop to be larger in order to produce more and to hire workers to help them.  They also want to get a vehicle for home delivery of the orders.

loans.use: Raw material for her business' growth

loans.name: James Gikundi

texts.en:
James Gikundi R. is a man of 31 years married to Pauline Keinda, who sells green vegetables. Together, they have three children. They live in Lodwar town, where James does his tailoring business. He has been in this business for 20 years now and gets a monthly income of 13,500 Kenyan shilling (KES).

This will be James' fourth loan from KADET LTD; he has been repaying all other loans successfully. With this loan, he plans to buy materials and make clothes so that he can sell the clothes. 

With the income he is going to get, he plans to open another tailoring shop in Lodwar town. In the future, James wants to be financially stable and to support his family by providing for their every basic need.

loans.use: To buy materials for making clothes

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann G. K. is thirty-two years old and married. Her husband is an electrician and they have two children, aged nine and five years old. Ann G. K. owns an M-pesa (m-mobile pesa-money) shop in which she does money transfer services. She also does sim cards registration as well as selling airtime. 

Her business is located near a college in Nairobi, so students form a large number of her clientele. She also provides the services to the local residents. She has been in this business for two years now and has managed to provide employment to one person. She says that this business is profitable. 

The only major challenge she has is financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of 45,000 KES to add float to grow her business and meet the demands of her customers. 

In the future, she wants to become a Safaricom dealer (local mobile phone service provider). She also hopes to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She describes herself as aggressive, caring and determined.

loans.use: Adding float to her business

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie A., from the town of Banga, is 27 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Ana Marie owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in farming for over five years now.

Ana Marie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from CEVI, she is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Ana Marie plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Zoila Patricia

texts.es: La señora F. es madre soltera labora como cajera y tiene un hijo ella solicita este préstamo para comprar playsen y cerrar un cuarto donde vive, agradece a CEPRODEL ya que con este segundo crédito ha logrado mejorar su condición en su casa
texts.en: Mrs. F. is a single mother who is employed as a cashier. She has one child. She requests this loan to purchase construction materials and to finish a room where she lives. She is thankful to Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) that, with this second loan, she will be able to make some home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Lorena

texts.es:
La Señorita  Maria Lorena de 23 años de edad es comerciante, pues se dedica a la venta de ropas, es soltera y tiene un  hijo varón de 2 años de edad. Es madre soltera.
Firma la solicitud de crédito con su tío, el señor Antonio Duarte, quien se dedica a la ganadería.
Es propietaria de una ropería bien surtida de ropas de temporada para damas caballeros y niños.
Solicita ayuda crediticia a Fundación Paraguaya para la compra de todo tipo de prendas de la temporada otoño-invierno. Obteniendo todas estas mercaderías estaría cumpliendo satisfactoriamente con todos sus clientes.
texts.en:
Srta. Maria Lorena is a 23 year old merchant who sells clothes. She is a single mother with a two year old son. Maria co-signed this loan application with her uncle, Sr. Antonio Duarte, who is a livestock breeder.

She is the owner of a boutique that is well-stocked with seasonal clothing for women, men, and children. Maria is requesting a loan from Fundación Paraguaya in order to buy all types of garments for the autumn and winter seasons. By obtaining this merchandise, she will be able to successfully fulfill the demands of all of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for the autumn and winter seasons.

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
Cuando Adriana María L. G. de 28 años decidió casarse tomó la decisión de montar en su casa su propio negocio, una tienda donde vende productos de la canasta familiar, lo que le permitiría aportar para cubrir los gastos del hogar, pues su esposo trabaja en algunas fincas y en algunas oportunidades no hay trabajo. 

Adriana necesita de un prestamo para comprar más surtido y así ofrecerle mayor variedad a sus clientes e incrementar sus ventas. En el futuro, esta luchadora sueña con ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
When Adriana María L. G., 28, decided to get married she made the decision to install a business of her own in her house; she has a store where she sells basic grocery items that allows her to contribute towards meeting household expenses because her husband works for large farming estates and sometimes there aren’t employment opportunities.

Adriana needs a loan to buy more stock to offer a wider variety of products to her customers thus increasing sales.  In the future, this fighter dreams with enlarging her business.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mapendo Group

texts.fr: Mwanaidi K. est leader du groupe d’affaire Mapendo, elle lève la main sur la photo, cliente au 15e  cycle de crédit,âgée de 43 ans,divorcée. Elle est mère de 10 enfants parmi lesquels 6 vont à l’école et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers.Notons qu’elle supporte seule la charge de ses enfants car son ancien mari l’a complètement abandonné. Elle a commencé ses activités avec un capital de son mari avant qu’ils divorcent.  Son Busines est de fournir les poulets aux hôtels,snack bars, restaurants de la ville,etc. Il y a 24 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité de vente des poulets. Avec ce nouveau crédit, elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 50 poulets. Dans l’avenir, elle planifie diversifier  ses activités et acheter un véhicule de transports. Mwanaidi K. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour les crédits qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. Le groupe  Mapendo est  composé des 19 membres majoritairement femmes.
texts.en:
Mwanaidi K. (raising her hand in the picture) is the leader of the Mapendo group and she's seeking her fifteenth loan. She's 43 years old, divorced, and the mother of ten children, of whom six attend school while others live on their own). It must be noted that she has to support her children by herself, since her former husband abandoned her completely.

She started her business with a capital obtained from her husband, before their divorce. Her business, which she has been running for 24 years, consists in providing chickens to hotels, snack bars, restaurants… of the city. With this new loan, she wishes to bolster her revenue by purchasing 50 chickens. In the future, she intends to diversify her business and purchase a transport vehicle.

Mwanaidi K. thanks Kiva's partner, MFI Hekima, for the loans she receives with no collateral at all. Thanks to these loans, she manages to provide for her children. Mapendo group is composed of 19 members, mostly women.

loans.use: to buy 50 chickens

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma N. lives in the Kawaala neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members. Fatuma has a hardware business.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. 

Fatuma sells her products at the market, retail.    Fatuma has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of cement, nails and pangas (machetes). The main business challenges for Fatuma include transportation and defaulters.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are start selling wholesale only and to buy a plot of land.   

Fatuma lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement, nails, and pangas (machetes).

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 32 años y vive en la misma ciudad del Cusco junto con sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 12 años tiene su pequeña ferretería pero el local es alquilado y ella vende por ejemplo herramientas, materiales de construcción y otras cosas más. Ella siempre compra materiales para así abastecerse el negocio. Es su crédito número 2 que tiene con la Asociación Arariwa, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal “Templo del Inca” porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercedaria como por ejemplo chapas y otras cosas más.

Olga es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a sus hijos y su sueño es importar su propia de marca.
texts.en:
Olga was born in Cusco, is 32 years old, and still lives in Cusco with her two children. For 12 years she has been renting a hardware store to sell tools, construction material, as well as other things. She is always buying products to supply her business. This is her second loan with Arariwa Association. She is happy to know she has this financial support since she has already demonstrated responsibility with repayments. She also likes being part of the Communal Bank "Inca Temple" since all of the members are responsible and have great solidarity. With the requested loan she will buy merchandise such as sheet metal and other supplies.

Olga is an enterprising woman who helps her children succeed and her dream is to import her own brand.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sheet metal and other supplies.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Dionicio; el tiene 68 años de edad y es viudo y tiene 5 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de llantas, el vende llantas de distintos tamaños para distintos tipos de carros, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a su hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de llantas. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas al por mayor.        
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "KANCHARY", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Dionicio, 68, is a widower with five children.  He alernates his daily activities with his tire-selling business.  He sells different sizes for different types of automobiles.  His work hours are from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  With his business he has been able to provide for his children.  He would like to expand his activity and improve his business, for which he is requesting a loan to buy wholesale tires.

He is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale tires.

loans.name: Kris

texts.en:
23-year-old Kris is a married man who lives in the town of Surallah, South Cotabato. At a young age, Kris learned farming from his parents. Now he tills his own land to earn a living for himself and his wife. Kris primarily grows corn. He sells his harvest at his town market. Kris also raises pigs in his backyard.

Kris will use his loan to purchase fertilizers, feed and vitamins. He hopes to earn better and save for the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last eleven years.  He is 41 years old, married to Damaris and they have five school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his 4th loan.  He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.  He will sell his produce at the local market as he does small-scale farming.

In future, David hopes to become a successful farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Ayeso

texts.en:
Ayeso now has a grocery store where she sells goods such as groundnuts, rice, and flour. She took a loan through BRAC south sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. 

Ayeso is married. She is 23 years old and has four children, two of whom are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: she want more income to able her purchase more rice, ground nuts for sale.

loans.name: Aravoi Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la cuidad de Caacupé. Ellas se unieron con el objetivo de generar más ingresos y de esa forma poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Ellas son mujeres luchadoras y muy sacrificadas. Comentan que no se cansan de trabajar, pues esa es la única forma en la que podrán cumplir el objetivo que se propusieron.
La señora Vilia está casada, vive con su marido y sus hijos, ella trabaja en la cría y posterior venta de cerdos y pollos, por medio de este trabajo ella ayuda en los gastos de la casa a su marido, para que esa forma el gasto sea compartido. Ella desea, algún día, poder tener una granja donde pueda albergar a más animales y de esa forma ampliar su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos y pollos, con esto podrá tener más animales, lo cual le ayudará a generar más ingresos con la venta de los mismos.
texts.en:
The women of the present committee are from the city of Caacupe. They meet together with the object of generating more income and in this form, offering a better future to their children. They are very sacrificing, combative women.

Mrs. Vilia is married, and lives with her husband and their children. She works at raising and later, selling pigs and chickens. With the work, she helps pay household expenses, aiding her husband in this way, so that the burden will be shared. Vilia wishes some day to have a farm where she can accommodate her livestock and in this manner, expand her business.

Vilia is requesting a loan to buy pigs and chickens, so she can have more animals, and generate more income with their sale.

loans.use: compra de cerdos y pollos para la cría y posterior venta

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MARIA ELENA MOYANO”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zonia, La socia tiene 48 años D. edad, la socia tiene 2 hijos D. 29 y 27 años D. edad, la socia tiene 2 locales D. bar restaurante, la socia se dedica  a la administración D. sus bar restaurantes, ella es muy buena en este negocio y ha puesto la segunda sucursal hace 2 años a tras y ahora esta tras D. la tercera, la socia tiene dos locales actualmente implementados y el tercero esta en arriendo y en el mes D. septiembre le entregaran el tercero para esto ella deberá tener dinero para implementar el nuevo bar restaurante. La socia también se dedica a la compra y venD. antigüedades como cuadros, muebles mesas, sillas, entre otras antigüedades. La socia solicita el crédito para implementar su negocio con la compra D. pintura, ceras, platos, vasos, copas, cubiertos, mesas, sillas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. muebles y menajería para implementar su negocio D. bar restaurante.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank Maria Elena Moyano, located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Zonia, 48, who has two children who are 29 and 27 years of age. The member has two restaurant-bar locations, and earns a living managing her restaurant-bars. She is very good at this business and set up the second location two years ago, and is now working on the third. The member has two restaurants already up and running, and the third is being rented out. In the month of September they will hand over the third to her, so she will need to have money to set up the new restaurant-bar. The member also buys and sells antiques such as paintings, furniture, tables, and chairs among other antiques. The member is seeking the loan to start up her business with the purchase of paint, candles, plates, cups, wine glasses, table clothes, tables and chairs. The member is seeking the loan to invest in the purchase of furniture and table settings for setting up her restaurant-bar business. 

The member appreciates the support to be given her, and thus promises to make her payments in a disciplined way.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of furniture and table settings for starting up a restaurant-bar business.

loans.name: Krisna Cassinni

texts.en:
Krisna Cassinni is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. Krisna Cassinni has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Krisna Cassinni is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Krisna Cassinni hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 56 años de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tiene tres hijas y tres hijos que se dedican a diferentes actividades, reside en la comunidad de La Puzunca.

Desde 1997 Gloria se dedica a la cria y venta de carne de cerdos, inició con la compra de un cerdo pequeño y luego de un tiempo solicitó un prestamo en FAMA y pudo comprar varios mas. Ella aprendió sola y uno de sus vecinos es su proveedor. Gloria se levanta desde muy temprano para realizar el oficio de su hogar y el cuidado de los cerdos, su esposo le ayuda con las actividades que a diario debe realizar como darles suero, concentrado y a lavar el chiquero. Su ventaja es que la inversion que realiza es a corto plazo y pronto puede volver a reinvertirlo. Su desventaja es que varios de sus vecinos se dedican a lo mismo y por temporadas el precio de la carne de cerdo se viene abajo por la excesiva oferta. 

Gloria solicita este prestamo para la compra de dos cerdos y con este apoyo podrá mantener su negocio activo y obtendra ganancias para la mantencion de su familia. Su sueño es tener una porqueriza mas grande. Este es el decimo ciclo de Gloria en FAMA y ha cancelado el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and married and her husband is a farmer. She has three daughters and three sons who work at different jobs. She lives in the community of La Puzunca.

Since 1997 Gloria has raised pigs and sold pork. She began by buying a small pig and then after awhile requesting a loan from FAMA so that she could buy several more. She learned on her own and one of her neighbors is her supplier. Gloria gets up very earlier to do her housework and take care of the pigs. Her husband helps her with the daily tasks she has to do, such as giving the pigs their concentrated whey and cleaning the pigsty.

Gloria has an advantage in that the investment she makes is short term and she is quickly able to see a return and re-invest. The drawback is that several of her neighbors are in the same business and the price of pork falls seasonally because of excess supply.

Gloria is requesting this loan to buy two pigs; with this help she will be able to keep her business afloat and earn income to maintain her family. Her dream is to have a larger pig pen. This is Gloria’s tenth loan cycle with FAMA and she has made all of her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж и сын находятся в России. Сама Саодат имеет среднее образование. Она у себя дома занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в основном для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Saodat lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 49 years old, married and has three children.  Her husband and son are in Russia.  Saodat has a secondary education.  She is involved in animal husbandry at home and breeds cattle primarily for sale.  She has been in this business for seven years.  Saodat is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: Для закупа коровы

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta had a strong determination to succeed. Four years ago, she operated a small sari-sari(variety) store in their village. But, due to the expensive costs of grocery items and minimal profit gained from it, she stopped the business and engaged herself in raising hogs for a higher income. She has been raising hogs, to fatten and sell to butchers in the village, for almost a year. She has been generating an income of PHP2,000 for each hog disposal. 

Julieta wants to strengthen her business and make it more profitable. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP10,000 to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines for hogs sustenance and to ensure good nutrition.

Julieta is now 47 years old and is married. She has four children, all attending to school. She wants to provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines to ensure good nutrition.

loans.name: Sweetie Pie

texts.en:
Our applicant is known as Sweetie Pie and, as her name implies, she is a lovable woman. She runs a sari-sari store, a community-based business that sells a variety of items in high demand in her area. Her husband is employed as a local agent for a distributing company based in their town. They have three children: Charmaine, 23 years old and a second-year nursing student; Hersal, 20 years old and a first-year college student; and Dennies Kae, 14 years old and a third-year high school student. They live in the village of Magsaysay, which is a few kilometers from the highway and near the local city hall. The village is known for rapid development and for its peaceful and orderly nature.

Her small store is open from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. Sweetie Pie decided to open her store because her husband's income is not large enough to support all the educational needs of their children.

Currently, Sweetie Pie is using her income to pay for the cost of having two children in college. She is seeking a loan to buy additional inventory for her store, including soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, vinegar, canned foods and other items. By expanding her business, she will be able to help her husband to meet more of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, cooking oil, sugar, snacks and drinks for her store.

loans.name: Brenda's Group

texts.en:
Brenda's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Brenda is 16 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past three years, Brenda has been working hard with her mother to manage her bar, which sells drinks and snacks to local customers. 

To help expand her family's business, Brenda has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more crates of beer, and will help Brenda's family to generate greater profits and contribute to her family's needs. Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land to build on. 

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Brenda's future prospects by helping her to become assertive, know herself as a woman, become a good member of the community.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of beer

loans.name: Shallot

texts.en: Shallot is standing close to a table on which she has displayed food items for resale. She also sells used clothing in Takoradi. She is married and has three children. For the past six years the income she makes from her sales has gone to support her husband in taking care of their children. The loan is going to be used to acquire additional food items to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to acquire additional food items to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Umoja B Group

texts.en:
Selina is the facilitator of the Umoja B group. Selina and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Selina takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Selina had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 6 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Selina was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Selina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Selina will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Umoja B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Selina is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is a farmer in the Kitale area of Western Kenya. She has been in active farming for nine years, producing mainly maize, vegetables and milk for the local market. She is married with 4 children aged between 8 and 1, with herself being 26.

Rukia has requested to Juhudi Kilimo for a loan of 60,000 KES to help her buy a cereal-grinding machine. She says this will enable her to generate more income which she will reinvest in her farm as well as educate her children. She adds that the rampant diseases call for farmers to have alternative sources of income to avoid total loss in farming during challenging seasons.

She adds high costs of production to the list of farming challenges.

loans.use: to buy a grain-processing machine

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire sans enfants.Il vend des journaux à domicile et dans les différents services publics et établissements privés de la ville.Il se lève très tôt le matin pour s'approvisionner auprès de l'unique grossiste de la ville pour revendre ses journaux au détail. Son commerce marche assez bien et lui permet de soutenir sa famille notamment pour les dépenses alimentaires, sanitaires et locatives. Pour renforcer son activité, il sollicite un prêt de 300 000f pour acheter des revues mensuels, des magazines de femmes et des  hebdomadaires de la mode en coiffure et couture.Son ambition est de louer une cantine en ville pour y établir une librairie.
texts.en: The borrower is a young single man without children. He sells newspapers door-to-door and in the different public and private establishments in town. He wakes up early each morning to stock up at the only wholesaler in town in order to resell his newspapers at retail. His business works pretty well and allows him to support his family, especially for their food, sanitary and rental expenses. To strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 300 000 francs to buy monthly magazines, women's magazines and weekly hair and fashion magazines. His goal is to rent a cafeteria in town where he will set up a bookstore.

loans.use: to buy monthly magazines, women's magazines, weekly hair and fashion magazines

loans.name: Marwin

texts.es:
Marwin tiene una microempresa dedicada a la fabricación y venta de artículos de cuero, especialmente de  bolsos y sus accesorios. El posee las líneas de: bolso baúl sintético, bolso manos libres y bolsos de cuero. Su negocio está ubicado en  una casa arrendada, en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, al sur de la ciudad de Barranquilla. El taller ocupa la sala-comedor, y el empresario reside en el resto de la casa. Sus ventas las realiza al por mayor, de contado y a crédito, a almacenes del norte y centro de Barranquilla.   Genera 6 empleos, incluyéndolo  él de él. Antes de emprender su negocio, era empleado en una empresa que elaboraba artículos de cuero. Además su padre lo inició en esta actividad, desde los 13 años de edad. Poco a poco ha comprado sus máquinas, con lo que ha consolidado una buena infraestructura física, con la que ha sido capaz de sostener a su familia. Sus   estados financieros reflejan una situación económica estable, con un inventario de materias primas aceptable, cuentas por cobrar con plazos relativamente cortos. Sus activos fijos muestran máquinas costosas, que le permiten elaborar sus bolsos con gran calidad y excelente acabado. Sus índices son excelentes, con un capital de trabajo adecuado y con rentabilidad normal, ajustado a lo que realmente genera este tipo de negocios
En la actualidad su para capital de trabajo  no es suficiente para lograr las expectativas de trabajo y crecimiento que él tiene , porque sus ventas se incrementan en el mes de Diciembre y debe prepararse para ello, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva,primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará materias primas, como cuero, cuerina, goma, herrajes, al por mayor y de contado, con el fin de aprovechar esta época de ventas altas, y así incrementar los ingresos y utilidades en su negocio.
texts.en:
Marwin has a microbusiness dedicated to making and selling leather goods, especially bags and accessories for them.  He has lines of synthetic box bags, shoulder bags, and leather bags.

His business is located in a rented house in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighborhood to the south of the city of Barranquilla.  The workshop is in the living-dining room and the businessman lives in the rest of the house.  He sells wholesale (in cash and on credit) to warehouses in the north and center of Barranquilla.
