He generates six jobs, including his own.  Before setting up his business he was an employee of a company that made leather goods.  His father also got him started in this work, from the time he was 13.

Little by little he has bought his machines and so consolidated a good physical infrastructure, with which he has been able to support his family.  His financial condition reflects a stable economic situation with an acceptable inventory of raw materials and short-term accounts receivable.  His fixed assets are costly machines that allow him to make his bags with great quality and excellent finish.  His rates are excellent, with adequate working capital and normal profitability, adjusted to what this type of business really generates.

Currently he does not have enough working capital to meet his work and growth prospects, because his sales grow in the month of December and he needs to get ready for that.  This is why he is turning to a Kiva loan, the first funding he is getting from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.

With the loan he will buy materials such as leather, imitation leather, rubber, and hardware, wholesale and in cash, with the goal of taking advantage of this season of high sales and so increase his income and profits in his business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, imitation leather, rubber, and hardware.

loans.name: Maria Leucadia

texts.es: Leucadia tiene 52 años de edad esta casada con el señor Aristeo y tienen 7 hijos pero nada mas 5 viven con ellos los cuales estudian la primaria y la secundaria. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante, ella desde hace mas de 12 años se dedica al cultivo de aguacate ya que su región es prolifera para que se de un buen aguacate, platica que en el año hay dos temporadas fuertes para su cosecha aguacate la cual obtiene buenas ganancias en esta temporada, dice que sus hijos le ayudan a la corta el fruto y lo sacan a vender por cubetas en la central de abastos de una población cercana a su localidad y dice que cuando no es temporada de aguacate se dedica a vender artesanía de Ocoshal en la capital del país. Doña Leucadia esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar insumos para el cultivo y el  buen estado de sus arboles como insecticidas, abonos orgánicos, fertilizantes, calidra y cajas para empacar el aguacate. La meta que tiene la señora es seguir progresando con su negocio y seguir abriéndose mercado en diferentes poblaciones de su estado para vender más rápido el fruto que cultiva. Dice que esta muy agradecida con la empresa por que gracias a esta ella puede comprar lo necesario para hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Leucadia, 52, is married to Aristeo and has 7 children.  The five who live with them are in primary and secondary school.  She is a hardworking woman who wants to get ahead.  For more than 12 years, she has grown avocados, since her region has the right conditions for good avocados and has two strong seasons for harvesting them.  She makes good money out of the current season.  Her children help her to cut the fruit and take them to sell them by the tray in the wholesale market of a nearby town.  She says that when it is not the avocado season, she sells handicrafts from Ocoshal in the country's capital.  

Doña Leucadia is seeking a loan to buy material for her crops and to keep her trees in good shape, such as insecticide, compost,  fertilizers, lime and boxes in which to pack the avocados.  Her goal is to keep up her business and to open up a market in different towns in her state so as to sell the fruit she grows more quickly.  She thanks Kiva's Field Partner for helping her to buy what she needs to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, compost, fertilizer, lime and boxes in which to pack avocados.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building a room

loans.name: Biranchi Narayana Shg Group

texts.en:
Radha is the leader of this Biranchi Narayana SHG that hails from a small village in the Nayagarh district of Odisha, India. She has two children who are in school. The member standing with her hand raised is Radha. With the help of her son, she has been doing a fruits, vegetables and flower selling business for the last 10 years. At present, her monthly family income is Rs 3,000 INR. But it is not sufficient to lead a better life. So she formed a self help group with 12 other members in her locality and applied for a loan. It is her first loan from People's Forum for the development of her business. With this loan, she will purchase fruits and vegetables in bulk and flower plants in a large quantity for the growth of her business. Her plan is to construct a house and to provide a higher education to her children. 

All the group members are engaged in different activities like animal raising, a grocery shop business, a food stall etc. All are very happy and thankful to Kiva's lenders for this support.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, vegetables and flower plants for her business.

loans.name: Juliette's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Juliette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 42 ans. Juliette a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Juliette est mariée à un électricien du nom de Nicoderme. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Juliette vend du charbon de bois et du pâté (aliment à base de blé) à son domicile et de façon ambulante depuis douze ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Juliette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Juliette sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs de charbon de bois.

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: Roy is 34 years old, widow with 2 kids and residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, Roy is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been in this business for seven years. Each month he earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of business. He requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional vehicle spare parts and accessories. In 2008, Roy joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) to gain access to financial services, to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. In the future, Roy wants to save money as a reserve for his kids future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for motorcycle.

loans.name: Elias

texts.en:
Elias lives in San Juanito, Chihuahua with his three beautiful children aged 9, 15, and 19 years of age. He started his business in clothing sales when he could not find a job. At the beginning he sold clothes by going door to door and with time he was able to earn his own clientele. Today his sales have increased and his clients are now going to his door looking for his business. For Elias his business is primarily important since it is his only source of income, but with it he has been able to support his family.

He requires a loan of $1000USD to buy merchandise so that he will be able to increase his sales, which is especially important during this holiday season when demand is so high. Elias plans to repay his loan in 6 to 12 months. He wishes to thank you for your support and for your generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Elias vive en San Juanito Chihuahua tiene 3 hermosos hijos de 9, 15 y 19 años de edad. Inició su propio negocio cuando se enfrento al problema de no encontrar empleo, por lo que se decidió a vender ropa, al principio comenzó vendiendo casa por casa logrando que a través del tiempo hiciera sus propios clientes. Actualmente sus ventas van progresando ya que ahora los clientes van a buscarlo a su propia casa. Para Elias es muy importante su empleo ya que es el único medio con el que obtiene un ingreso y puede cubrir los gastos de su familia.

El requiere de un préstamo de $1000 USD para comprar mercancía que le permita incrementar su capacidad de venta debido a que esta temporada navideña sus clientes se han incrementado y están demandado mucho su mercancía. En un término de 6-12 meses Elias planea retornar el préstamo; el agradece tu apoyo y generosidad.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Shola

texts.en:
Shola is married and has 2 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region settled in the Fizuli region, Bala Behmenli village.
Having borrowed $400 she bought 2 calves.
Now she needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.
This 47-year-old woman has run this business for 5 years.
She is a very kind, friendly and hard-working person.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Murni

texts.en: Murni  is 49 years old, and is married with four children. Three of them are boys while the other is a girl. To supplement her husband’s income, Murni sells various snacks and spices in front of her house at her small store. In a day Murni  can earn  of $3 and eventually she can earn around $63 in a month. She needs a loan of $100 and with this loan, she can buy more goods to sell and thus more or less double her income.She really wants to earn more money for her children's education  and to give them a better life than she grew up with.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Seang

texts.en:
Mrs. Seang S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 3 children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by purchasing custard-apples from a nearby plantation and reselling them to the people in their community. With this business venture, this couple can make on average about $8/day in revenue.

Currently, Mrs. Seang S. has requested a loan to purchase more custard-apples to meet her clients’ needs. She is confident to make a lot of money for the next two years.

loans.use: To purchase more custard-apples for her inventory.

loans.name: Miswati

texts.id:
Miswati is a hard working rice seller tas she needs to have additional income because her husband who works as a bag and sandal seller cannot earn enough for the family.

Everyday Miswati starts the day at 4 am to cook the rice, the vegetables and others. She needs to be at Gilimanuk market at 8 am to open her rice stall. She usually opens the stall until 11 am.

With a start up capital of Rp 500,000 (US$ 53) she started this business. To protect her food from dust and flies, she always puts her food inside a glass display cabinet. From that capital, she can get daily profit in average of Rp 30,000 (US$ 3)/ day. This profit is used to buy the rent to the Market authority of Rp 1,000 (10 cent)/ day and also to finance the school for her 3 children who are now at primary school.

The loan from DINARI is going to be used to add more stock such as snack and soft drink with the hope that these additional merchandise will increase her revenue. With higher revenue she is hoping to be able to put her children to higher education.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Miswati seorang pedagang nasi yang ulet, karena penghasilan suaminya sebagai seorang pedagang tas dan sandal tidak mencukupi untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga. Oleh sebab itu jam 04.00 pagi Miswati harus sudah bangun untuk menyiapkan dagangannya, mulai dari memasak nasi, lauk pauk dan sayuran, karena jam 08.00 Miswati sudah harus sampai dipasar Gilimanuk untuk membuka usahanya.Miswati membuka usaha ini sampai jam 11.00 siang. Dengan modal awal Rp.500.000.- , Miswati membuka sebuah warung nasi. Untuk menghindari makanan dari debu maupun lalat maka dagangan tersebut ditempatkan pada sebuah rak kaca. Dari modal tersebut Miswati bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp.30.000 setiap hari. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk membayar sewa (karcis pasar) sebesar Rp.1.000 setiap hari, dan juga untuk biaya ketiga orang anaknya yang sekarang sudah duduk dibangku sekolah. Sedangkan pinjaman dari Dinari rencananya dipakai untuk menambah barang dagangan seperti makanan ringan maupun minuman dengan harapan penghasilan yang diperoleh lebih banyak lagi.Dan nantinya anak-anak Miswati bisa melanjutkan kesekolah yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use: to add the capital to enable her to stock some soft drinks for her rice selling business.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica is a single mother. Her daughter, Martha Pamela, is 11 years old, and Angélica focuses all her efforts on giving her a better quality of life. Money from the job she has a local plant isn't enough to provide for her daughter's education and pay the bills, and Martha's father doesn't give them any support. To earn extra income, Angélica sells beauty products and cosmetic supplies in her free time. Thanks to the help of her daughter, who offers the products to her teachers and the parents of her classmates, Angélica has been able to acquire numerous customers.

Of course, many times Angélica's efforts aren't enough, and her business still doesn't provide enough for the family on its own. To restock her products, Angélica is requesting a loan of $1,125, which she will repay within six months. The money will help Angélica purchase more merchandise so customers will go to her during Christmas time. With your help Angélica and little Martha will be able to keep moving ahead together.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Angélica, es madre soltera de Martha Pamela de 11 años de edad, y por ella está haciendo todo su esfuerzo por brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, puesto que con el trabajo que tiene de planta no le alcanza el dinero para poder mantener los gastos de la escuela y del hogar. Y el papá de la pequeña Martha no las apoya con los gastos. Actualmente, se dedica en sus tiempos libres a vender artículos de belleza y cosméticos. Los cuales gracias a su empeño y el apoyo que le brinda su hija al ofrecer los productos a sus maestras y a las mamás de sus compañeritos ah podido adquirir varias clientas.

Sin embargo los esfuerzos en muchas ocasiones nos son suficientes en este momento, puesto que su negocio todavía no puede mantenerse por sí solo, para resurtir los productos por lo tanto Angélica está solicitando un crédito de US $ 1,125 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Angélica podrá comprar más mercancía que sus clientas compran en estas temporadas navideñas. Con tu ayuda Angélica y la pequeña Martha podrán salir adelante juntas.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Thi Xuyen

texts.vi:
Mrs Xuyen is 40 years old and she has two school age children. Her family owns a bridal shop and studio at Bac Ninh for several years. Her store provides dress-up service for the brides, wedding clothes and photography on various occasions. She has worked very hard to get to the point where she is now. She has borrowed from the local bank where she lives. After knowing about the loan program Binh Minh, she applied and was initially given a maximum credit of VND2,600,000. She requests for a loan of $US150.00 to buy more studio equipments and wedding gowns.

Translate from Vietnamese by Hien T. Lam, KIVA volunteer.

Chị Xuyên 40 tuổi, có 2 con nhỏ đang đi học. Gia đình chị mở ảnh viện áo cưới (cửa hàng áo cưới có kèm theo dịch vụ chụp ảnh) ở phố Chờ, Bắc Ninh đã nhiều năm nay. Cửa hàng chị cung cấp các dịch vụ áo cưới, trang điểm cô dâu và chụp ảnh các loại. Để xây dựng được cửa hàng như ngày nay, chị đã trải qua rất nhiều khó khăn và chị cũng đã từng tham gia vay vốn của ngân hàng nơi chị sinh sống. Khi biết đến chương trình tài chính vi mô Binhminh, chị đã đăng ký vay và bước đầu được duyệt ở mức là VND2,006,000 để mua thêm phụ trang cho một số mẫu áo cưới và các thiết bị về ảnh.

loans.use: To purchase photographic equipment

loans.name: Maria Berenice

texts.es:
Maria Berenice is 41 years old. She studied up until her Junior year of high school. Maria has 3 children which still depend on her for support. Her home is located in Ricardo Palma in the district of Mache, in the province of Otuzco, in the state of La Libertad. Maria buys and sells cereals such as barley, wheat, dry potato, “chocho”, and broad bean. Additionally Maria raises and sells cattle, sheep and guinea pigs. These she sell in the Wholesaler’s Market in Trujillo.

Maria is one of the founding members and one of the main organizers for the communal banks in Mache. She is a member of the Communal Bank of Progressives, from which she received her first loan of S/. 300.00. With this money Maria began her first business and an ingredient for cheese manufacturing and sold it in the distinct villages of the area..

With this loan of S/. 2,500.00 ($875.00), which will be repaid in 4 months, Maria will purchase 14 sacks of wheat, 7 sacks of “chochos” and dry potato, and a few kilos of curds.

Maria dreams of building her own home in Trujillo and opening her own business there.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Berenice tiene 41 años de edad, estudió hasta el cuarto año de secundaria, tiene 3 hijos que aún dependen de ella. Su vivienda está ubicada en el caserío Ricardo Palma en el distrito de Mache, provincia de Otuzco, departamento La Libertad.

La señora Maria se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales tales como cebada, trigo, papa seca, chocho y habas, además de animales como reses y ovejas. Asimismo cría cuyes, los cuales los vende en el Mercado Mayorista de la ciudad de Trujillo.

Es socia fundadora y una de las motivadoras de la formación de bancos comunales en Mache. Pertenece al banco comunal “Progresistas”, en el cual obtuvo su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00. Con este dinero inició su primer negocio, compró quesillo para preparar queso y venderlo por los distintos caseríos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 14 sacos de trigo, 7 sacos de chochos, papa seca y unos cuantos kilos de cuajada.

La señora Maria sueña con construir su casa en la ciudad de Trujillo y ahí poner su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of cereals and dry goods for resale.

loans.name: Namayira Centre E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Fatuma M.. She is currently in the business of selling sweet potatoes and is requesting a loan to increase stock. Fatuma is 20 years old and is married. Her husband has a wholesale business. She has 4 children ranging from age 5 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Fatuma makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Fatuma has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 180000 in order to increase stock and the loan was paid back on time.

Fatuma is joined in her small group by Ayubu N., Tapie I. and Jiida N.. Ayubu N. has a business in trading pigs and wants to expand business. Tapie I. is currently operating a business in poultry keeping and wants a loan to purchase more poultry feeds. Jiida N. operates a business of art and craft sales and wants to add in craft business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of sweet potatoes and increase stock

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida H. is an Internally Displaced Person from the Fuzuli region of Azerbaijan. She has lived with her family in Beylagan since 1993. She is 35 years old, married and has five children. She raises chickens in her yard and sells them in the Beylagan city bazaar. She has been engaged in this business for more than seven years. She applied to Normicro Beylagan Branch for a KIVA loan of $800, and she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business of raising chickens.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is 35 years old and is married woman with 4 children, ages 8-15 years old. Bahati is a vegetables seller, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Bit by bit I've been able to build my house. But, in order for me to be able to live in it, I need to add some safety features and complete the exterior. This is why I request a loan of $1,000.00. I wish to finish all these projects in order to be able to live in it.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Poco a poco he construido mi casa. Pero para poderme ir a vivir, pero me esta haciendo falta las protecciones y los acabados del exterior de la casa. Es por eso que solicito un préstamo de $1,000.00 dlls. Para la terminación de los acabados y protecciones en mi casa y así poder vivir en ella.

loans.use: Completion of the exterior of his house and safety additions

loans.name: Muzzafar

texts.ru:
Muzzafar H. is a farmer. He has already been practicing agriculture for two years, and he has several cows, whose milk he sells wholesale. Now he would like to buy another dairy cow, which will increase production and his profit. His business also helps secure access to fresh milk for local residents. In order to buy another cow, he decided to take out a loan. It will be paid back over a period of 12 months. Muzzafar is married with four children. The family is large and high spirited.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Холиков Музаффар –фермер. Занимается этим видом деятельности уже 2 года. Имсеет несколько коров . Молоко , которых продает оптом. Хочет купить еще одну корову , которая будет давать молоко. Этим он увеличит объем получаемой продукции и соответственно прибыль. Кроме того его бизнес помогает населенгию приобретать свежее молоко. Но для того чтобы купить еще одну корову он решил воспользоваться кредитом , погасить который сможет в течении 12 месяцев.Музаффар женат и имеет 4 детей. Семья большая , но веселая.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Wilber

texts.es:
Wilber is a diligent young man who finished high school a few months ago. His financial limitations did not allow him to continue his studies at University, so he opted to continue studying at a Technical College. This young man, with the support of his brothers, decided to work as a blacksmith, making a variety of steel rings for cord. This small, but indispensable business generates the income that allows him to cover the costs of school. Wilber is hard-working but does not have sufficient raw materials to continue making steel rings at this time. He needs a loan of $375, money with which he plans to purchase iron and wire to continue his work.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva volunteer.

Wilber es un diligente joven que hace algunos meses concluyó sus estudios secundarios, sus posibilidades económicas no le permiten seguir estudios universitarios, por ello, optó por continuar una carrera técnica superior. Actualmente este joven, con el apoyo de sus hermanos decidió dedicarse a elaborar variedad de argollas para sogas, este pequeño, pero indispensable negocio le está generando ingresos que le permiten cubrir las necesidades de sus estudios superiores.Este joven hacendoso en estos momentos no cuenta con suficiente materia prima para seguir elaborando sus argollas, desea obtener un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero con el que tiene planeado comprar fierro y alambre para seguir con su trabajo.

loans.use: To purchase iron and wire to continue making steel rings for cord, enabling him to pay for technical school.

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 30 years old. She is married with four children aged between 1 and 14.

Mwajuma began selling clothes in 2004. She works daily from 6AM to 4PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 (US Dollars) in sales.

Mwajuma has successfully taken out two previous loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She hopes for a new loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi: Chị Thắng năm nay 30 tuổi, Gia đình chị hiện có hai con còn nhỏ.Ở địa phương nơi gia đình chị sinh sống có nghề may găng tay nên  năm 2007 khi chị  tham gia vào Quỹ  tình thương chị cũng xin vay vốn để đầu tư mua vải về may gang tay bán cho các đại lý thu mua. Ngoài làm nghề may găng tay gia đình chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn, gà. Thu nhập hiện nay của anh chị khoảng 2,5 triệu /tháng.  Anh chị muốn vay thêm vốn về để mua vải may gang tay bán
texts.en:
Ms. T. is 30 years of age, she has two small children. The community where her family resides has a growing business for glove making. In 2007, she joined the organization and was able to use her initial loan to invest in buying materials; making gloves and selling them to bigger companies. Beside the business, she raises pigs and chickens. The family present income is about 2.500.000d/month. She is requesting a loan in which she plans to buy more materials and supplies.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tailoring

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria I., 36, is married and has three children. She has five years of experience making and selling ice cakes and pancakes. She sells her products six days per week. She has three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala ($187 USD).  SPBD loans are Maria's only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. She will use her loan to buy ingredients for the business like plastic cups, sugar, Kool aid, vegetable oil, and flour. One of her daughters helps her with the business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business

loans.name: Cristhian

texts.es: Cristhian tiene 44 años, esta casado, tiene 2 hijos. El, conjuntamente con su esposa elabora y vende en su domicilio las chipas que producen, y en algunos casos realiza venta en forma ambulante en su vehiculo por todo el dpto de la Cordillera, en su domicilio tiene una especie de kiosko dónde ofrece sus chipas, y en la misma registra muy buena venta y esto se debe  porque existe una muy buena circulación de gente frente a su local.n Este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres y hoy el maneja su propio negocio, el cual tiene una antigüedad de más de 12 años. Conjuntamente con su esposa se dividen las actividades,  la especialidad en elaborar las chipas es de herencia familiar. El local tiene una vista muy particular, uno cuando compra las chipas puede estar observando el momento de la elaboración, ya que el local es amplio y por sobre todo lo mas importante: es muy higiénico.n
texts.en:
Christian is 44 years old, he is married and has 2 children. He, alongside with his wife, makes and sells corn and cheese breads (chipas). Sometimes he sells his products with his car going throughout all the region of Cordillera. In his house he has a stand from where he sells his chipas and in he makes very good sales because he is located in a well travelled area. He learned his trade from his parents and today he runs his own business, and he has been running the business for the past 12 years. He and his wife share the duties. Making chipas is a family heritage. Their stand bears a very unique look because when clients purchase chipas they can also see them being made. The stand is large and very importantly, it is very clean.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase start, cooking oil, and cheese.

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin S. leads a loan group with five members, all of whom live in Kvav village in Takeo Province. She works as a basket maker and her husband also works, but they do not earn enough income to support their family. That is why Mrs. Rin S. has decided to apply for a loan to buy a cow and start a cow-breeding business. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. She is 27 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school while the third is too young to work or study.

Three members of this group have end-of-term loans, while the rest of have monthly-payment loans. The people in the first group are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the end of the term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are very beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To buy a cow and start a cow-breeding business.

loans.name: Association Ditorguine Agoe Zongo Group

texts.fr:
Cette association est Située dans le quartier Agoè Zongo dans la ville de Lomé (Togo), l’association DITORGUINE AGOE ZONGO est une association qui fut crée en 2005 et regroupe en son sein  trois (3) femmes dynamiques, toutes clientes de WAGES : madame D. sofi, S. Afi et A. yawa manthe. Elles sont toutes mariées avec des enfants à leurs charges. Cette association exerce dans trois types de  commerce : l’alimentation générale et boissons, les marmites en aluminium et les chaussures dames dans le marché d’Agoè Zongo et s’approvisionne au marché voisin d’accra au GHANA et aussi au grand marché de Lomé.
Cette association a déjà obtenu un (01) crédit de 50,000F auprès de WAGES qu’elle a remboursé sans problèmes, elles sollicitent ce troisième crédit pour agrandir leur stock de marchandises avec vingt marmites en Aluminium, des sacs de riz, des bidons d’huile, de tomates et de pâtes alimentaires et trente quatre paires (34) de chaussures pour dames.
texts.en:
Ditorguine Agoè Zongo is a business partnership based in the Agoè Zongo neighborhood of Lomé, Togo. It was formed in 2005 and comprises three energetic women, all clients of WAGES: Madames Sofi D., Afi S. and Yawa Manthe A.. They are all married with dependent children. They trade in three areas--general foodstuffs and beverages, aluminum cooking pots, and ladies' shoes--in the marketplace of Agoè Zongo. They purchase their stock at the nearby Accra marketplace in Ghana, and at the central market of Lomé. This partnership has already received one loan of 50,000 francs from WAGES, which they paid back without incident. They request this, their third loan, to increase their stock of merchandise with twenty aluminum pots, sacks of rice, drums of oil, tomatoes, noodles, and thirty-four pairs of ladies' shoes.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of aluminum cooking pots, foodstuffs, and footwear

loans.name: Ni Wayan Dewi Artati

texts.id:
Walaupun usianya yang masih muda,namun Dewi Artati tidak berpangku tangan untuk menanti kiriman uang dari  Wayan Pri Hutama, suaminya yang bekerja di luar negeri. Sebagai kesibukan yang sekaligus sebagai pekerjaan utama adalah beternak babi.Usaha ini sudah dilakukan sejak menikah hingga sekarang. Hanya ketekunanlah yang membuat usaha ini bertahan samapi sekarang. Saat ini setiap hari sudah disibukan memelihara lima induk babi yang harus diperhatikan setiap pagi dan sore seperti memperhatikan kedua anaknya yang masih kecil-kecil. Anak pertama masih sekolah kelas dua Sekolah Dasar dan yang kedua masih balita. Wayan Tri Hutama masih menyelesaikan kontrak kerja selama satu tahun lagi baru berkumpul dengan istri dan kedua anaknya. Jadi dalam sehari harinya Wayan dewi Artati disibukan dengan kedua anaknya dan ternak-ternaknya.

Untuk pinjaman pertama kalinya ini dana dipergunakan hanya untuk persiapan membeli pakan saja, karena keperluan induk babi sudah cukup terpenuhi . Keperluan pakan ternak untuk lima ekor induk mencapai 15 kg dedak padi dan jenis makan tradisional. Dari kelima ekor induk babi biasanya diatur kehamilan induknya sehingga dalam setiap bulan dapat menjual bibit babinya. Satu induk babi melahirkan 8-10 ekor bibit babi dan yang akan dipelihara sampai satu setengah bulan dan sudah dapat dijual. Penghasilan bersih dalam satu bulan dapat mencapai Rp. 500.000,- s/d Rp.700.000,- .Dari usaha inilah Ni Wayan Dewi Artati dapat mencukupi keperluan sehari hari bersama kedua anaknya yang masih kecil-kecil dan mencukupi keperluan sehari harinya.
texts.en:
Dewi Artati is a housewife. Her husband, Wayan Pri Hutama works as a migrant worker as a laborer overseas. They have two children, the 1st one is already at elementary school and the 2nd one is still a toddler.

Dewi Artati doesn't want to just sit around awaiting for money remittance from her husband. She raises pigs to get extra money for her family. At the moment she already has 5 breeding pigs. Her daily routines are attending these pigs and also raising her two children. Her husband's labor contract at overseas will end next year, so she still have to wait for another year to get together again with her husband.

Dewi is planning to participate in the DINARI foundation's loan program. She wants to use the money to buy pig's feed. One breeding pig can produce around 8 - 10 piglets. These piglets can be sold after they are 1.5 month old. She can earn a net profit of IDR 500 thousand to 700 thousand per month (around USD 47 - 67/ month).

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Elvania's Group

texts.en:
Elvania W. is a member of Kewerimidde lending group in Katosi. She is a strong married older lady. Elvania has a business selling petrol from a pump in Katosi and she has been able to educate her children; the last-born has just completed Makerere University. She mainly sells to taxi owners, trucks that collect sand as well as to personal vehicles, and the market is still good because she has a loyal customer base.

Elvania is also a farmer both for sale and home consumption as well as owning two cows that give her milk. She now works hard to ensure that her orphaned grandchildren attain the best of education. She needs another loan to help with filling her pump with petrol plus employing manpower on her farmlands for better yields.

loans.use: petrol to fill her pump plus manpower for her farm.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet Y. is married and mother of two kids who are currently in senior high school. She is a 37-year-old trader. Currently she lives with her husband in a rented apartment together with the children.

She trades in garment cloths and lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, Abena buys a few stocks of lace materials and sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. Janet belongs to a village bank called ‘Kyeremaa’. She also hope to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of lace materials and textile

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 41 años de edad, hace 20 años vive con su pareja y padre de sus tres hijos. Años atrás se dedicaba a trabajar conjuntamente con su esposo en el labrado de la tierra, pero debido a que sus hijos empezaron a estudiar sus necesidades se incrementaron, entonces empezó a vender verduras de forma ambulatoria en el mercado de San Ramón, ubicado en la selva central de Junín. Al iniciar su negocio sufrió mucho, ya que muchas veces se quedaba con sus productos sin vender porque no tenía clientela, decidió retornar a las labores agrícolas, pero su esposo la motivó una vez más a seguir en su negocio. Acaba de cumplir 5 años de esta actividad, y le resultó ser muy rentable, lo que le permite solventar la educación de sus hijos. Irma es una cliente muy seria, en todo este tiempo ha tratado de pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, el cual se siente muy agradecida por permitirle trabajar. El dinero que solicita es para incrementar su capital de trabajo para el incremento de su mercadería, y una parte la usará para la compra de los útiles para sus hijos que están en el colegio.
texts.en:
Irma is 41 years old and has lived with her husband and the father of her three children for 20 years. Years ago, she worked with her husband as an agricultural laborer, but due to the fact that her children began studying their needs grew, so she began working as a traveling saleswoman selling vegetables in the market of San Ramón, located in the central jungle of Junín. In the beginning, her business suffered greatly--many times she was left with unsold produce because she didn't have a clientele. She decided to return to agricultural work, but her husband encouraged her to continue her business. After five years of this activity, it has become very profitable, which allows her to afford her children's education. Irma is a very serious client. She has always tried to be punctual in her payments. This is her eighth loan with MFP, to which she is very grateful for allowing her to work. She will use the loan to increase her merchandise and also to purchase school supplies for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар - женщина , которая кредитуется в Микроинвест уже третий год.Она использует свой займ для расширения своего бизнеса.Её точка реализации находится вблизи её дома.Её ассортимент товаров составляют хозяйственные принадлежности.Она каждый раз ездит за товаром в Истаравшан. У неё имеются свои постоянные клиенты, которые покупают у неё товар.Следующий займ она хочет использовать для мини ремонта своего лорька.
texts.en:
Sanavbar has been a client of MicroInvest for three years. She uses her credit to expand her business. Her retail outlet is located close to her home. Sanavbar sells household products and supplies. She travels to Istaravshan every time she needs to obtain her goods. She has loyal clients who purchase products from her. Sanavbar wants to use this loan to remodel her retail store.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Store remodeling

loans.name: Johanna Lucía

texts.es: La joven Johana Lucia G. M., tiene la edad de 23 años, habita en el barrio San Juan, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen  dos hijos , los cuales estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ella desde hace 12 años trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo , ella inicio esta actividad agrícola con sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de sus padres . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes. Para lograr una buena producción y poder obtener mejores beneficios en esta cosecha, da las gracia a la institución por los logros adquiridos.
texts.en:
This young woman, Johanna Lucía G. M., is 23 years old. She lives in the San Juan neighborhood with her husband and she helps him with the household expenses. They have two children who are still in school. Their plans for their family are to improve their living conditions. Johanna has been working in agriculture for the last twelve years and the biggest problem she has are the infestations that get into the fields. She started out in this field with her own efforts and the support of her parents. The financing that she wants is for the purchase of supplies and fertilizer, in order to obtain a good crop and get better profits when it is harvested. She gives thanks to AFODENIC for the successes she has achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer to improve the crop.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta R. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old and married, with three school-aged children. To earn a living, Violeta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The business’ main source of revenue is raising pigs for sale. Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a new loan from ASKI for 6000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

About ASKI: ASKI is a pioneering microfinance institution in the Philippines. It is committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Antonia Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Antonia Guadalupe tiene la edad de 55 años, casada y con dos hijos de 12 y 14 años de edad, ambos estudian la primaria, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua. Su esposo se desempeña como contador y ella vende ropa y cosméticos desde hace ocho años el cual inicio con fondos propios, sus planes para su familia es poder terminar de hacer mejoras a su casa, y espera incrementar el volumen de sus ventas con la captación de nuevos clientes, con este préstamo en Afodenic lo quiere para comprar materiales de construcción y poder hacer un baño. Da las gracias ala institución por que es de gran beneficio poder obtener el crédito con la facilidad de pago y proyectarse en las mejoras de su casa, como en el bienes
texts.en:
Ms. Antonia Guadalupe is 55 years old. She is married and has two children (ages 12 and 14) who are still in school. They live in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. Her husband works as an accountant, and Antonia sells clothes and cosmetics for the past eight years. She began her business with her own funds. Her plans for her family are to finish improving her home, and to increase the volume of her sales by getting new customers. With this loan from Afodenic, Antonia wants to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom. She gives her thanks to Afodenic, as it is very helpful to obtain a flexible loan in order to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Omina

texts.ru: Омина Джураева 1964 года рождения , замужем имеет 4 детей. Высшего образования не имеет.  На рынке торгует 5 лет яйцами.  Долгое время не могла найти работу. Подруга посоветовала получить кредит  и заняться бизнесом.  Убедившись о развитии бизнеса,  получила кредит на развитие своего бизнеса. Первый кредит получила в 2004 году. Сейчас ее оборот увеличился, и развивает за счет кредита от КИВА .
texts.en:
Omina J. was born in 1964. She is married and has four children. She does not have a higher education. For five years, she traded in eggs at the market. For a long time, she was unable to find work. Her girlfriend advised her to take a loan and start up a business. Convinced of the need to develop her business, she took out a loan to expand her business. She took out her first loan in 2004. Now, her turnover has increased and is developing through a Kiva loan.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 500 eggs

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María D. Jesús vive con sus hijos y su esposo el señor Gerardo, son una familia muy unida y que se apoyan mutuamente.
El es taxista desD. hace 1 año y la señora María D. Jesús tiene un negocio D. abarrotes D. nombre “Abarrotes El Borre” establecido desD. hace 4 años, negocio que ha dado muy buenos ingresos ya que gracias a la dedicación y el esfuerzo ‘por salir adelante los empuja a luchar, y por tal motivo ellos están solicitando este crédito para la compra D. mas mercancía a proveedores.
texts.en:
María D. Jesús lives with her children and her husband, Gerardo. They are a very united family, and they support each other. He has been a taxi driver for one year. María D. Jesús has a grocery business called “Abarrotes El Borre”, which she started four years ago. The business has given her very good income thanks to her dedication and effort. They push her to fight to get ahead. That is why she is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise from suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en: Moeun S. is a 26-year-old fish vendor and the mother of three school-aged children. Every day in early morning, Moeun S. and her husband always go to buy fish from the fishermen and they hurry up and bring their fish by motorbike to the market for resale. In addition, Moeun S.’s husband also uses his existing motor to pick up passengers for fees. Moeun S. is leading her investment more smoothly. She has a lot of regular customers who buy and eat her fish. She hopes to be able to look for extra income by using a Kiva loan to purchase a large quantity of fish to sell. She proposes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase equipment for her husband to begin fishing.

loans.use: To purchase  a large quantity of fish to sell

loans.name: Carmen Rosa De

texts.es: Carmen tiene un solo dependiente de 13 años de edad; tiene casa propia. Carmen rosa y su esposo el señor Fausto tienen 2 fuentes de ingreso 1) ventas de abarrotes o pulpería en el domicilio, 2) ingreso por su micro bus que trabaja en la línea 67. La competencia en el trabajo como mecánico no es alta ya que cuenta con clientela, de equipo pesado pero en la pensión la competencia es alta, pero cuenta con sus pensionados con una demanda similar. Los solicitantes  ocuparan el dinero para hacerle una mantención  a su micro bus. El crédito actual es su séptimo crédito u operación, con excelentes referencias de puntualidad.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa has one 13-year-old dependant. She also owns her own home. Carmen and her husband Fausto have two sources of income. They do in-home grocery sales. They also make money by working on micro-bus line 67, where the mechanical work isn’t as demanding as it would be if they were serving individual clients. However, it’s still necessary to use some heavy equipment, and there is a lot of competition for fares. Carmen and her husband will put this money toward maintenance for their micro-bus. This is their seventh loan; they have an excellent record of punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Celia Ignacia

texts.es: La señora Cecilia Ignacia Mejía A. tiene la edad de 53 años, es una mujer casada, esta Señora tiene 2 hijos de los cuales ninguno dependen de ella. Su propósitos son de aumentar su negocio además desea seguir ayudando a sus hijos y dejarle a ellos un futuro en el negocio  para que el día de mañana pueda mantenerse por si solos. Su actividad económica es venta de granos básicos hace mas de  de 8 años, que se dedica a esta actividad. La ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado. Ella da inicio a este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante y es entonces que implementa el negocio. el financiamiento será utilizado para capital de trabajo ya que necesita realizar la compra de los granos básicos para suministro de su trabajo ya que ella lucho mucho para conseguir un trabajo y este le ha proporcionado la ayuda necesaria para salir adelante agradece siempre trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas.
texts.en:
Cecilia Ignacia Mejía A. is 53 years old. She is a married mother of two children, neither of whom are dependent on her. Her goals are to expand her business as well as continue helping her children so she can leave them with the business in the future for them to care for on their own. She has made a living selling basic grains for the past eight years, and her business is located in the local market. She started the business out of necessity to make headway. The loan she is requesting will be used for working capital because she needs to purchase basic grains to supply her business. She has fought hard to get her job and it has provided her with the necessary support to keep moving forward. She is grateful as always to work with Kiva partner Fundación León 2000 and the friendly organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Juan Magdaleno

texts.es: Don Juanito como es conocido en su comunidad de paxtoca del municipio de Totonicapan su principal fuente de ingreso es como chofer de camioneta de Totonicapan ha Quetzaltengo todos los dias lleva ya trabajando mas de quince años, hoy en dia esta construyendo para tener una vivienda digna para el y para toda su familia el necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales ya que esta en la ultima fase de la construccion en sistema de drenaje para que la lluvia no le perjudica.
texts.en:
He is known as Don Juanito in his community of Paxtoca in the municipality of Totonicapan. His main source of income is as the driver of a van from Totonicapan to Quetzaltengo. He has driven the van more than 15 years. Now he is building a house in order to have a decent place for himself and all of his family. He needs a loan to buy materials and is already in the final phase of the construction of a drainage system, which will prevent rain damage.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Materials

loans.name: Las Huastecas Group

texts.es:
GRUPO LAS HUASTECAS

ESTE GRUPO SE ENCUENTRA UBICADO EN LA HUASTECA POTOSINA EN LA PARTE SUR DEL ESTADO DE SAN LUIS POTOSI COLINDANDO CON EL ESTADO DE QUERETARO, XILITLA ES UN LUGAR TURISTICO MUY VISITADO POR EXTRANJEROS, YA QUE CUENTA CON LUGARES PARADISOACOS NATURALES, SU CLIMA ES CALIDO ES CALIDO-HUMEDO.
EL GRUPO SE CONFORMA POR 4 SOCIAS:
MARTHA PATRICIA H. C.
MARIA OLIVIA M. Z.
LAURA H. C.

ESTAS PERSONAS SE DEDICAN DESDE HACE MAS DE 3 AÑOS A LA VENTA DE CATALOGO ESTA ACTIVIDAD LES HA AYUDADO A SACAR A SU FAMILIA ADELANTE Y APOYAR A SUS ESPOSOS CON LOS GASTOS DE SU FAMILIA

LA SRA. VIRGINIA M. Z. SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE ZACAHUIL DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS, ACTIVIDAD QUE REALIZA TODOS LOS DOMINGOS VENDIENDO A ORILLA DE CARRETERA. ACTUALMENTE LA SEÑORA TIENE 51 AÑOS, TIENE 5 HIJOS 2 DE ELLOS DEPENDEN DE ELLA, ESTA ACTIVIDAD LES HA AYUDADO A DARLES ESTUDIO Y A COLABORAR CON EL GASTO DE LA CASA. ESTA SEÑORA SOLICITO UN CREDITO DE $2,000 EL CUAL UTILIZA PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA COMO ES HOJAS DE PAPATLA, SIMILAR A LA HOJA DE PLATANO, CHILE CHINO O CASCABEL, MANTECA Y CARNEDE PUERCO Y POLLO PARA LA PREFERENCIA DE LA GENTE. UTILIZA UN HORNO DE BARRO QUE SU ESPOSO LE HIZO EN SU CASA MISMO QUE CALIENTA 3 HORAS ANTES DE METER A CUESER EL ZACAHUIL Y LO DEJA ENCOCIMIENTO DE 8 A 9 HORAS PARA QUE QUEDE LISTO PARA EL DIA DOMINGO, TODO ESTE TRABAJO LO REALIZA UN DIA ANTES. SIENDO ESTA ACTIVIDAD UNA TRADICION DE ESTA REGION.
texts.en:
Las Huastecas Group This group is located in the Huasteca Potosina in the southern part of the state of San Luis Potosí bordering the state of Queretaro. Xilitla is a tourist place, which is visited by many foreigners. It has natural places that are like paradise. Its climate is warm and humid. The group is comprised of four people; Martha Patricia H. C., Maria Olivia M. Zuñiga, and Laura H. C.. For over three years these people have been selling by catalog. This activity has helped them get their families ahead and helped their husbands with the family expenses. Virginia M. Zuñiga has been making “zacahuil” (a large tamale) for ten years. She does this every Sunday, and she sells by the side of the road. She is 51, and she has five children. Two of the children are dependent upon her. This activity has helped her give her children an education. It also helps with the household expenses. She is asking for a loan for $2,000 to buy raw materials like “papatla” leaves, which are similar to banana leaves. She will also buy Chinese chili or “cascabel”, shortening, pork, and chicken for her customers’ preferences. She uses a clay stove, which her husband made in her own house. It heats for three hours before she puts the zachuil in the oven. She leaves them in for eight to nine hours so that they are ready for Sunday. She does all of this work one day ahead of time. This activity is a tradition in this region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Making “zacahuil” (a large tamale)

loans.name: Vossin Rhode

texts.fr: L. Vossin Rhode est née en 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Vossin Rhode vit depuis dix ans à Djassin à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Vossin Rhode est mariée à KOUKPO Anauld et est mère d’un enfant qui n’est pas encore scolarisé. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Il y a de cela cinq ans que Vossin Rhode mène comme activité la vente de chaussures, tissus et friperies au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo et à Cotonou. Vossin Rhode mène également comme activité secondaire la vente de produits de beauté. Vossin Rhode achète ses articles au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. Vossin Rhode a bien remboursé le premier crédit qu’elle a obtenu de ALIDé, et est à son deuxième crédit. Ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter la taille de son activité et de la diversifier.
texts.en:
L. Vossin Rhode was born in 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  For ten years, she has been living in Djassin in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin.  She is married to KOUKPO Anauld and the mother of one child who is not yet in school.  The couple shares in covering family expenses.  Five years ago, Vossin Rhode ran a business selling shoes, fabrics, and second-hand clothing at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo and in Cotonou.  She also ran a secondary business selling beauty products.  She buys her goods in Nigeria, a country neighboring Benin.  Vossin Rhode has repaid the first loan she obtained from ALIDé and is now on her second one.  This loan will enable her to expand her business and to diversify it.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes and various items (used clothing, etc.)

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 50 years old, and she is happily married to Alfredo C.. They are blessed with seven children; four of them are girls and three are boys. They live in a village located at Brgy. Murong, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Most of their children did not pursue their college studies due to financial constraints. Although they work hard to earn a living, their income is not enough to cover all their basic expenses.

Farming is the common source of their living; they cultivate their farm, planting rice and some vegetables. Due to financial difficulties, Trinidad engages in rice retailing to help her husband earn income. Since rice is the basic commodity needed in their village, she wants to acquire more of it but she has not got much capital. Trinidad wants to borrow the amount of P 9,000 to be used in acquiring more rice to sell in their village. She believes that she will be able to uplift their living conditions through this financial assistance.

loans.use: Additional capital for her retailing business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Dudu is 35 years old and married. Her husband is a charcoal burner. She has nine children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services. The programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria C., from the village of Centro 2, is 30 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns and operates a specialized retail store whose income is derived from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Engaged in her business for over seven years, she earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP that was used to to purchase additional products to sell, she is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Gloria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her enterprise.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Hope Group 2, Mukono

texts.en: S. Grace is 45 years old and divorced with seven children of her own in her care. She has been in the business of selling clothes from Kikko for nine years, from which she makes about $315 in profit a week, although she still faces the challenge of lacking enough capital. She makes certain that her stock is of good quality, which attracts more customers. Grace has hopes of building a house for her children plus educating them to the University for Self Reliance in the future. She needs a loan to be able to buy more quality clothes for resale.

loans.use: Buy more clothes for her shop expansion.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
47-year-old Edgardo needs additional capital for his business. He manages a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) rice field and is involved in a hog-raising business.

Edgardo wants to do well in his business so he can provide for his family’s needs. His wife, Mary Grace, and their three children are what give him comfort and joy at the end of the day.

Edgardo applied for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. This loan will help him achieve an abundant harvest and expand his hog-raising business.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and to expand his hog-raising business

loans.name: Flora's Group

texts.en:
Flora A. is from the town of Dibuluan in Jones. She is 51 years old. Flora is the leader of a 11-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Dibuluan Group.

Flora is single. To make a living, Flora owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Flora has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Flora joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Flora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Flora's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: C2348 Abahuzarugwiro Group

texts.en:
Florence was born in 1974 and is married with six children aged from 2 to 12 years. She and her family live in the Gasabo district, Kigali province, in the region called Kabuga.

Florence owns a small business in the market selling cassava flour. Her husband has no job and that is the reason why Florence works hard to provide all the needs of her family.

Florence is the leader of a group called Abahuzarugwiro in the local language; this group contains eight members. Each member has a different business such as timber and foodstuffs. As all of them are women, they work hard in order to resolve their particular problems.

Florence, who is the leader, has two years experience. The hours of her business are from six in the morning to four in the evening every day, even during the weekend. Right now, Florence’s seed money is not enough to attract more customers and this is the reason why she is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more cassava flour.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Rosario Fabiola

texts.es: Rosario tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos,  en la casa de su suegra.Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos (corazón de res condimentado cocinado  a la parrila). Cada día muy temprano prepara sus platillos y ya en la tarde los vende, su negocio se ubica  en la esquina de la casa de su madre porque es una zona muy transitada. Vende todos los días hasta altas horas de la noche  y esta muy satisfecha ya que obtiene ganancias regulares, además cuenta con  su principal  herramienta de trabajo que es una parrilla pequeña fácil de transportar. De esta manera  consigue tener los ingresos  que ayudan a sostener la economía de su hogar, y su deseo para el futuro es mejorar su negocio ofreciendo mayor  variedad de platillos.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir progresando.Rosario tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de ingredientes que  necesita para la preparación de sus platillos como  carne, salchichas, palitos,  carbón y aceite.
texts.en:
Rosario is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children. They live in the house of her mother-in-law. For the past two years, she has been selling “anticuchos” (pieces of spicy beef that are cooked on a grill). Each day she wakes up early to prepare her dishes and them sells them in the afternoon. Her business is located at the corner of her mother-in-law’s house because it is a busy area. She sells every day until the late hours of the evening and is very pleased to obtain a regular income. Her main piece of equipment is her small grill because it is easy to transport. This helps her to have income to financially support her household. Her wish for the future is to improve her business by offering a greater variety of dishes.

This is her first loan with MFP. Rosario is very grateful to everyone who made it possible for her to access this loan so that she could continue progressing. She plans to invest the money she requested in the purchase of ingredients and supplies in quantity that she needs for preparing her dishes such as meat, sausages, skewers, charcoal, and oil.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies to continue her food business

loans.name: Lizabeth

texts.en:
Lizabeth A., is from the village of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lizabeth sells dry goods.  Lizabeth has been in business for over 5 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Lizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  She is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks for her store.  This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC.  Lizabeth plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.
------------------------
About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
49-year-old Tita G. is a widow who works hard in her business to gain profit to support the financial needs of her seven children. Her eldest, who is 21 years old, has not been able to pursue her education in college due to Tita’s small income which is sometimes not even enough to support the needs of her six remaining children whose ages range from 8 to 19.

Despite her failure to graduate her eldest child from college, Tita is still hopeful that, by growing her business making and selling “bandi” (sweet peanut delicacy), her profit will increase as well. Then she would be able to support her children’s education, especially her second child who is now in her second year. In two more years she will be graduating and hopefully will have a better career in the near future.

“Bandi” is one of the most popular delicacies of Antique province and tourists buy it as a present. Demand for this product is increasing as the province industrializes. Tita wished to have large amount of capital to increase her production, thus meeting the demands of her customers.

With that, Tita is hereby requesting a much larger amount of loan through ASHI and, with that amount, she wishes to expand her market coverage. She is also hoping that she will be able to have more vendors in different places to increase her turnover.

loans.use: To purchase a large volume of ingredients for "bandi" production

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn P., 50, has been planting a variety of crops on farmland he owns and typically earns around US$4 per day. He lives in a commune in Phnom Penh, the capital, with his wife and their two children, while another two children are married and live separately. His wife, Mrs. Noun Ly, 50, who appears in the photo, is a farmer who grows rice for a living.

To increase his family's income, Sorn P. wants to improve his farming business, but he lacks capital. Hence, he would like to request a loan of US$800. With the loan, he will buy a couple of cows to help plow the farmland, as well as buy fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy a couple of cows as well as seed, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Raji

texts.en:
Raji is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has five members living in his household. He has been working as a car mechanic for 15 years. His customers include friends and neighbors from his community. He is proud of his ability to manage his money well. He says that he has had some difficulty in securing enough financing for his business.

He is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to invest in a machine that can test a car’s carbon levels. He also wants to invest in a new business: a small picnic/seating area located next to one of Lebanon’s rivers. He will rent out the tables to families who want to enjoy the day sitting next to the river. This will be his first loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase auto repair equipment

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty P. is from the town of Banga. She is 44 years old. Liberty is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Liberty owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Liberty has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Liberty joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liberty is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Liberty from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and supplement the family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Lunsar Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Lunsar” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Isatu S. is the leader of this group. The 30-year-old is married to a businessman and they have 2 children. Isatu has been a businesswoman for 8 years now; she sells soft drinks, beer, butter, milk, cocoa, sugar, etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy soft drinks, beer, butter, milk, cocoa, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Medy

texts.en:
Medy S. is from the village of Guinabot. She is 32 years old, married and has school-aged children. Medy has been selling household items in the local community for the past 5 years. Through this activity, she is able to earn a monthly net income of 2,600 PHP. In 2009, Medy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Medy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. Medy is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Medy from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For the expansion of her business

loans.name: Jorge Aladino

texts.es:
Jorge Aladino V. M. tiene 25 años. Es soltero vive con su padres, no tiene  hijo, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar. 

Jorge  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Rey de Reyes, que está ubicada a hora y media de Chillanes. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el primer préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Jorge  se dedica a la agricultura, siembra cacao y maracuya. Realiza sus compras las realiza cada mes en Matilde Esther y las ventas las realiza en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en semillas para cacao y maracuya. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños es tener una plantación para aumentar la producción. Enfrenta desafíos es el clima y las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta los deportes.
texts.en:
Jorge Aladino V. M. is 25 years old. He is single, does not have any children, and lives with his parents in the Chillanes district in the province of Bolívar. Jorge is a member of the Rey de Reyes rural loan group, which is located an hour and a half from Chillanes. In all, there are 23 members of the group, and the majority of them make a living farming. This is the first loan that Jorge has taken out with Cooperativa San José. Jorge also makes a living farming: he grows cacao and passion fruit. He makes his purchases in Matilde Esther each month and also sells his produce there. Jorge will use the loan he is requesting to invest in cacao and passion fruit seeds. He sees the loan as an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have a field so that he can increase his production. The main obstacles he faces are the climate, pests, and diseases. Apart from farming, Jorge enjoys sports.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing cacao and passion fruit seeds

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria J. lives in the village of Brgy. Paniki, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 60 years old, married and has five grown children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store where she sells products people use daily, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from her work.

In 2006, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid eight previous loans from ASKI and is applying for a new one, for 10,000 PHP, to buy more items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bayarbileg

texts.en:
Bayarbileg G. is a 53-year-old widow who lives with her two children in the Central province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter is a student and her son attends a local middle school. 

Bayarbileg has been living in her town for 21 years and now she operates a clothes-making business with the help of her daughter. Bayarbileg worked as a quality examiner of DaDi Mongol, a local garment industry from  2004 to 2008 and since 2009, she has owned her own small tailoring shop where she not only sews traditional Mongolian-style clothing, but also sews European-style clothing in cooperation with a tailor.  

Because she has gained a lot of experience, she knows what her customers want and how much they are willing to pay for her quality clothing. She wants one day to upgrade her old sewing machine to a newer, more sophisticated one so that she can experiment with more elaborate designs in her clothing. Bayarbileg is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more fabrics and other materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and other materials

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad C. owns and operates a motorcycle service. She is 59 years old, widowed and has one grown-up child. She is from the village of Migpange, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Trinidad has been in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Trinidad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Trinidad is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchased spare parts for the motorcycle. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for a motorcycle

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza S. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Annaliza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Annaliza is just starting this business.
In 2009, Annaliza joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Annaliza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
