loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane E. is from the village of Zone 1, Kabacsanan, Iligan City. She is 30 years old and married with four school-age children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling a variety of food products (including "bolad" or dried fish) in the local community. Her husband runs a motorcycle transport business. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $155 a month from these activities.

Mary Jane joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: Zone 1, Kabacsanan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Keo Village Bank Group

texts.en: A village bank loan which consists of fourteen people is located in Troeuy Troeng village in Kandal province, and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sokha K. is the village bank president. She is a dessert seller and is also a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more general products to resell to earn more income and improve her business. Her husband, Mr. Chhuon Bunthoen, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sokha K. is 44 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy more general products to resell to earn more income and improve her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk for her business

loans.name: Joyce Nyaboke

texts.en:
Joyce Nyaboke M. has sold maize, beans and millet to loyal customers for over four years. Her business is located in a semi-urban town called Keroka. Her business challenge is reduced demand from customers when there is drought or floods. Joyce will be using the loan of KES 20,000 to buy more cereals.

Joyce is married to a mechanic and they have four sons ranging from six to twenty years. Her goal in life is to have a big store and be a cereal dealer. She describes herself as social and ambitious.

loans.use: To buy five bags of maize and five bags of beans

loans.name: Wantoni B Group, Mukono

texts.en:
K. Robert is the leader of his group in Mukono. He is a single parent with two children of whom one is in school while the other is not yet in school.

Robert has a retail shop in Wantoni and also has an office that caters for girls and boys that would like to find employment like maids, shamba boys (gardeners) and casual laborers.

Robert is grateful for his previous loan because he was able to make profits that helped him pay his workers and save. He needs a new loan to be able to restock his shop with more goods so as to make more profits.

loans.use: To restock his retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Yann

texts.en: Yann V. is 23 years-old and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store, making approximately US$5 profit per day, while her husband, pictured here, is a cow dealer. He typically makes US$10 a day. The couple has two young children. Yann V. is asking for a loan of US$1200 for her husband to purchase cows to resell.

loans.use: To purchase cows.

loans.name: Badamhand

texts.en:
Badamhand is 45 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a 'ger', a traditional Mongolian tent. Her son is 24 years old and works as a welder in a private company while her younger son is 18 years old and attends university. Unfortunately, her husband is handicapped; he stays home and needs care every single day.

Badamhand operates a clothes-making business at her home in her town. She started her business operation after working as a dressmaker at a state factory from 1985-1996 (until it closed down). During this time she gained much experience and skill in her trade. Today, her business is well known throughout her community and her customers like her business because she can produce products specific to their needs. She both designs and produces all of the clothes, 'ger' cover and curtains with the help of her sister, using 2 sewing machines that she bought.

With her business profit she has been able to start building a workplace and a house which has not been completed yet. Moreover she was able to pay for her children's education. Badamhand works hard to grow her business and provide quality products to her customers. Her business is very important to her as it is the only source of income for her and her family. She says, "For the future I want to expand my business and am planning to buy new equipment and hire two more assistants.”

Badamhand is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~420 USD) loan to purchase fabrics and materials to sew more products.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials to make more products.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle F., age 26, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is bringing up her three children by herself so she makes sure that she works hard so that her family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own ready-to-wear clothing business.

Michelle has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow from CCT’s cooperative quite a few times. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her Ready-to-wear clothing business.

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 12,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business. She will use the funds to buy more clothes to restock her current product inventory. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have enough money for her children’s education. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions, wigs and a hair dryer

loans.name: Andres Arnaldo

texts.es: El Sr. Andres Arnaldo S. J. de  25 años de edad, es padre soltero tiene 1 hijo menor. Tiene casa propia ubicada en el Caserio de la Venta Alta. Trabaja como obrero de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño a logrado adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir la vivienda ya que se encuentra en construcción. Su sueño es lograr construir toda la vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sr. Andres Arnaldo S. J. is a 25 year old single father with one dependent child. He has his own house in the village of Venta Alta and works as a farm laborer for an agro-industrial company. Andres is an enterprising person who, thanks to his efforts, has been able to acquire his own property.

His house is in the middle of construction, so Andres is requesting a loan to bring this process to completion. His dream is to have his entire house finished so that he can achieve a better quality of life. He is very grateful for the support that we have provided through this funding.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of his house

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily bakes and sells loaves of bread to earn a living. The demand for her loaves of bread is high and she is happy because she is the only person that bakes in her community and this means more profit and patronage for her loaves of bread. She hopes to own a world-class bakery in the future. She is 49 years old, married with 3 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home.  She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more baking materials to boost her business. She hopes to lift her business and family above poverty. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials to boost her baking business.

loans.name: Toung

texts.en: Mr. Toung E., a resident of Srae Ampil village in Kandal Province, was born in 1972 and has five children, four of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the youngest is only two years old. Toung is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which he grows vegetables for sale to support his family. Toung's farm is currently infertile and it is far from an irrigation systE., so in order to improve his productivity he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. His wife, Mrs. Srey Mom Chom, shown on the right in the photo, is a soup seller in the village.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Kumudu

texts.en:
Kumudu is 30-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, part of the Matara district. Her husband is a jewelry maker, and they have one infant child.

Kumudu has managed a business sewing and selling clothes for two years. She has asked for a 40,000 rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase cloth to further develop her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth for her business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a 34-year-old married man. He has been operating a retail shop for six years. He also farms with his wife, who practices dairy farming. He is a member of a Faulu Kenya group called "Gathaiti Tuinuane." 

He managed to open a retail shop with the help of a KES 20,000 loan from the organization, which he succssfully repaid. He has requested a loan of KES 40,000 to add sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, soap and brooms to his inventory. He hopes to enlarge his shop into a wholesale store in the future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour, cooking fat, soap and brooms

loans.name: Vecky

texts.en:
Vecky M. is currently in the business of selling cooking oil and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of onions to sell.  Vecky is 29 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent out.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
K. Ahmad has spent several years in the agriculture business growing potatoes and wheat on his land. He also raises cattle. It is important to stress that he is a man whose responsibility is to provide for his family by giving them all that is necessary for their development.  He has a friendly family who are always trying to help each other. 

Today Ahmad needs a loan to obtain technological assistance for his crops. With part of the loan he will also purchase cattle to increase his number of animals. He awaits the approval of this loan confidently, knowing that it will be of enormous use to his business, and that his family will benefit greatly.  The loan will improve Ahmad’s income and his family's living standards, for which he offers a sincere thank-you!    

Ahmad’s wife appears in the photo.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history.  It was the site of a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions. 
	
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after it gained its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History 

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is from the village of Guinabot. She is 33 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Mary Jane owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Mary Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used for the expansion of her business. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Las Colinas Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra trabajando dentro del tercer ciclo de comité del programa comite de mujeres, todas estas trabajando con mucha esperanza para mejorar sus trabajos y también sus ingresos con el objetivo de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

Así cada una de las señoras trabaja de forma independiente dependiendo de la necesidad de la zona en que se encuentran.
Estas señoras son de familias muy humildes y las zonas donde viven son muy despobladas y con muchas necesidades, pero todas procuran para salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Lida quien se dedica a la venta de comestibles, ella prepara todo muy temprano en su casa y luego sale en las zonas donde concurre mucha gente de esa forma para vender todos sus comestibles.
Ella tiene varios hijos y su marido no cuenta con ingreso fijo suficiente para mantener la familia ya que es jornalero, es por ello que ella procura muchísimo para salir adelante.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes como dulces de leche y guayaba, carne, verduras, aceites, y otros.
texts.en:
This committee is in its third loan cycle as part of the Committee of Women Entrepreneurs Program. They are working with great hope of improving their businesses and incomes so that they can raise the quality of life for their families. Each woman works independently based on the needs of the communities where they live. These women are from very modest families and live in areas that are sparsely populated yet have many needs. They all seek to move forward. One of the members is Sra. Lida who sells food. She prepares everything very early at home and then goes to places where many people gather in order to sell all of her inventory. Lida has several children, but her husband works as a farm laborer and does not earn a steady income that is sufficient for supporting their family. For this reason, it is difficult for them to get ahead. Lida is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as condensed milk, guavas, meat, vegetables, oil, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase condensed milk, guavas, meat, vegetables, oil, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy pants, shorts, sandals, shirts for men and women, bikinis, bath slippers, boxers for men, and panties

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch A., 50, is married and lives with three of her children in the Takeo province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$1 a day and are supported by two of their children working in a garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into what is a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, Touch A. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$700 to purchase fertilizer. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Tohirboy

texts.en:
K. Tohirboy has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. He is an exemplary husband in that he always tries his hardest to provide food for his wife and two children in their home. After purchasing his cattle, Iskandar provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, Iskandar sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale. 

Currently he needs to purchase cattle to raise and for this reason is turning to IMON International to obtain a loan of $1,000. Iskandar thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to small entrepreneurs.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. 

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle to raise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda L. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Yolanda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with one son. She sells food; cheese, butter, ketchup, etc. at the local food market. Natalya started this business 5 years ago. At that time she had a job but the salary was too small to take care of her family. Today Natalya has got a developed business, two sales locations and many repeated clients. This business is the main source of income for Natalya’s family. 

Natalya is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnas to increase her working capital. The food is getting more expensive and she needs more money to purchase the same amount of food to sell.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Las Amigas De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
ALCOM “LAS AMIGAS DE LOS ANGELES”
Gladys L. Malparida tiene 23 años vive en el asentamiento humano los Ángeles segunda etapa en el distrito de san Juan de Lurigancho, es madre soltera; su pequeño bebe aun tiene dos años fruto de una relación que tuvo anteriormente.
 Gladys se dedica a la confección de artesanías como pulseras, aretes, collares, binchas, llaveros y otros más; este trabajo lo realiza en su propia casa, donde vive con sus padres y su pequeño hijo; cuando ella sale a vender sus productos su madre es quien lo ayuda en el cuidado de su pequeño hijo. 
  La alcancía  acaba de ser formada por ocho entusiastas socias quienes vieron en EDAPROSPO –PROSPERIDAD la oportunidad de crecer en sus negocios, tener  una mejor calida de vida y sacar a delante a sus familias quienes son el motor y el motivo por los que luchan constantemente día a día
  El sueño de Gladys es convertirse en una prospera empresaria y poder exportar sus productos a otros países; ya que este negocio lo empezó desde muy joven, y ve que su negocio va creciendo cada día mas, ahora tiene a cargo dos  personas quienes lo ayudan a la confeccion de estas obras de arte.
  Para ello el reciente préstamo lo usara como capital de trabajo comprando la mayor cantidad de materiales que necesita para la fabricación, porque sabe que por fiestas navideñas se triplica la demanda. Y ya tiene varios pedidos por entregar.
 Gladis en la foto se encuentra de pie y viste una casaca color beige un polo de color azul.
texts.en:
Gladys L. Malparida is 23 years old and lives in the Los Ángeles settlement in the district of San Juan de Lurigancho, Lima, Peru. She is a single mother; her baby from a previous relationship is only two years old.

Gladys makes handicrafts such as bracelets, earrings, necklaces, hairbands, and keyrings. She works in her own home, where she lives with her son and her parents. When she goes out to sell her products, it is her mother who takes care of her son. 

The communal bank is formed of eight enthusiastic members who see in EDASPRO – PROSPERIDAD the opportunity to grow their businesses, have a better quality of life, and help their families get ahead. Their families are the motive for their daily hard work. 

Gladys’ dream is to become a prosperous businesswoman and be able to export her products to other countries. As she started the business at a young age and it is growing each day, she now employs two people to help her with making these art works. This loan will be used to buy raw materials, as she knows the demand will triple with the coming holiday season. And she already has several orders to fill.

In the photo, Gladys is standing, with a beige jacket and blue shirt.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for handicrafts.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina pertenece al banco comunal “Juntas y Unidas” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad. Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos Incas. Construida en la base de la antigua ciudad Inca. 

Justina tiene 46 años, es madre y padre para sus tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de materiales de construcción como por ejemplo arena, piedra chancada y yeso. La puede encontrar a la socia todos los días de 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la noche en su pequeño negocio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Justina es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que saca a delante a su familia. Con su próximo préstamo, Justina que espera recibir $ 700 USD. Por el momento,  desea incrementar el negocio y va comprar materiales de construcción como arena, piedra chancada, etc.   
 
Justina se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Justina belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United) Communal Bank with the Asociación Arariwa.  The bank is in the city of Cusco, and she lives in that city.  Cusco is a charming city that dates back to the time of the Incas. It is built on the site of the ancient Inca city.

Justina, age 46, is both mother and father to her three children.  She sells construction materials like sand, stone, and gravel.  She can be found in her small business everyday from seven in the morning until six at night.  She has been in this business for several years.  It is going very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Justina is a hard-working and responsible woman who gets her family ahead.

Justina hopes to receive $700 USD with her next loan.  For now she wants to increase her business.  She will buy construction material like sand, stone, and gravel, etc.

Justina is grateful for the opportunity she is being given with this loan and therefore pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy construction material like sand, stone, and gravel, etc.

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: José Ramón tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de medicamentos naturales. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. El inicio por la falta de empleo que tiene nuestro país, esto lo impulso a buscar una fuente de ingreso necesaria. Tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, el se preocupa por proporcionarle los ingresos mas importante como estudios, salud y alimentación. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de medicamentos en general ya que tiene varios pedidos.
texts.en:
José Ramón is 49 years old and sells natural medicines.  He has had this business for more than four years.  He began it because of the lack of jobs in this country, which compelled him to find a source of income.

José Ramón has two young children to care for.  He worries about how to give them the most important things, like education, health and food.  The loan he is asking for is to purchase medications in general since he has many orders to fill.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ochirsuren

texts.en:
Ochirsuren L. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His oldest son attends a local primary school. 

Ochirsuren owns and operates his own wooden product business, specializing in ger parts, ger furniture, and other larger furniture pieces. He started his business in 2007, making a variety of wooden items in his home, after working and living in the countryside as a herder till 2006. 

All of his products are made with great care and attention to detail, which has earned him a reputation among his customers as a quality furniture provider. He usually produces a variety of wooden items according to his customers' orders. 

For the future, he hopes to continue to operate his business with stable operation so that he can afford to buy a car for his business. His only wish is to provide a good education for his children. 

He is requesting a 1200000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of wood and timber for his furniture-making business.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of wood and timber

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Carmen, tiene 47 años de edad, es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, Cñia. Isla Ybate, tiene 2 hijos que ya están en edad de ayudarlas y su marido trabaja como taxista en la ciudad de Asunción.

    Hace varios años que trabaja como vendedora ambulante, comercializa distintos productos como: huevos caseros, carne de chancho, queso, también vende productos artesanales, realiza sus recorridos en la ciudad de Asunción, cuenta con clientelas formadas.

       Agradece a la Fundación  Paraguaya y kiva por la oportunidad de préstamo que le otorga para así incrementar el nivel de su negocio y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y de la familia.
texts.en:
Carmen is 47 years old.  She is from the city of Carapeguá, Cñia.  She has two children who are old enough to help her and her husband works as a taxi driver in the city of Asunción.

Carmen has been working as a street trader for several years.  She sells a variety of products such as: home-raised eggs, pork and cheese.  She also sells handicrafts.  She sells her products in the city of Asunción and has an established customer base.

Carmen is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for providing her with this loan which will help her to increase her level of business and thereby improve her own quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, eggs, oil and cheese

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina, de 42 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora, que vive en compañía de su mamá Julia, de 76 años, a la que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay. El trabajo de Marcelina, es la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de comestibles, donde todas las mañanas desde muy temprano abre sus puertas para comercializarlos  a los pobladores de su localidad; pero como ella es una mujer muy activa, por la tarde se dirige a sus cultivos de papa, maíz y arveja, los cuales cuida desde hace ya 20 años, donde pudo aprender no solo las técnicas de cultivo, también a comercializar a buen precio sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Pero el pasatiempo de ella es cuidar de sus animales entre vacas y carneros. Ahora Marcelina, desea aumentar la cantidad de animales que posee para poder incursionar en la elaboración de queso. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, y se siente orgullosa de pertenecer a su banco comunal, donde sus integrantes son personas integras y sobre todo responsables. De obtener el crédito solicitado, planea invertir en la compra de 5 bolsas de semilla de arveja, que oscilan entre los 550 soles cada uno.
texts.en: Marcelina, age 42, is a single and hard-working woman who lives with her mother Julia, age 76. She cares for her mother in her own home in the Cumutay hamlet. Marcelina sells basic needs products in her food store, where she opens her doors very early every morning to sell to the residents of the area. Since she is a very actie woman, she cares for her potato, corn and bean crops in the afternoon. She has been doing this for 20 years, and she has learned not only the cultivation techniques, but also how to sell her harvests at a good price in the wholesale market of her city. Her pass-time is caring for her animals, cows and sheep. Marcelina wants to increase the amount of animals that she has in order to start making cheese. This is her eighth loan with MFP, and she is proud to belong to her community bank, where the members are upright and responsible. When she obtains this loan, she will invest in the purchase of 5 bags of pea seeds, which cost approximately 550 soles each.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba E. sells second-hand clothing at Abura. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a security man. Aba has been selling second-hand clothing for four years. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to expand her second-hand clothing business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene D. is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 33 years old. Arlene is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business venture in the food sector raising fish. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising fish for sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Arlene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
41-year-old Belinda D. S. lives in the town of Banga with her family. She is engaged in farming and owns land that she and her husband cultivate. They plant and harvest rice crops that they sell to rice traders. Belinda works hard to keep their farm productive. She is hoping for a better harvest.

Belinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to buy additional fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To buy additional fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Vannra

texts.en:
Mrs. Vannra T. (pictured with her young daughter) is 40 years old. Her husband, Mr. Bunly Kin, is 45 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have five children – one son with a full-time job in a hotel in Phnom Penh, and four daughters. One of their children is married, and the other three are in school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Vannra stays at home and takes care of her children. The main source of income for her family comes from her husband’s business. He is a house builder. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to get work.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo, es 44 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado. Vive en su casa propia con su esposa Blanca, de 45 años y sus 3 hijos de los 4 tiene en total, por quienes se esfuerza mucho para sacarlos adelante. Desde muy joven se dedicaba a negocios informales y que las realiza hasta en la actualidad, pero hace 5 años alquiló esta tienda aledaña a un mercado muy concurrido. Desde entonces con su esposa trabajan a la par en este negocio, por ello de manera ínter diario se provee  las frutas al por mayor, del mercado mayoristas a costos asequibles, captando así mayores utilidades. El negocio que realiza le gusta mucho, por ello mientras su esposa vende en su tienda, él recorre las calles con su triciclo vendiendo sus frutas y, de ese modo capta buenas utilidades, con las que cubre la educación y el bienestar de sus hijos y paga  el alquiler mensual; muy costoso del local de su negocio. Es por ello, que este emprendedor hombre trabaja arduamente con la convicción, que en  adelante se compre su propio puesto dentro del mercado ó aledaño a ello. Pero, por el momento su prioridad es abastecerse de variedad de frutas, ya que en esta temporada de verano  vende bien. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y dice “que le tengan confianza, porque él es muy grato y responsable” y que también le gustaría pagar contar con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa abastecerse de diversidad frutas con propiedades diuréticas, por ser muy solicitadas en esta temporada.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 44 years old.  He is an honest and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 45 year-old Blanca, and three of his four children.  He works very hard to get his family ahead in life.

Rodolfo has been working in informal businesses since he was very young.  Five years ago he rented a store next to a very busy market.  Since then he has worked together with his wife in his business.  Every couple of days they supply their business with fruit from the wholesale market at an affordable price.  In this way they make good profits.

Rodolfo enjoys his business a lot.  While his wife sells in the store, he travels the streets in his three-wheeled vehicle selling his fruit and, in this way, they make good profits which cover their children's education and well-being and the monthly rent for their business premises which is very expensive.  This enterprising man works hard with the conviction that in the future he will buy his own stall in the market itself or nearby.  For the moment, his priority is to stock his business with a range of fruits since they sell well in this summer season.

This is Rodolfo's first loan with MFP and he says that they trust him because he is very pleasant and responsible.  He would like to be able to count on further loans.  Rodolfo will use his loan to supply his business with a range of fruits with diuretic properties since they are very much in demand this season.

loans.use: to stock his business with fruits which have diuretic properties

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra.  Ysabel  de 44 años,  de estado civil soltera, con un  hijo que ya tiene 10 años dedicándose al sector de la confección y artesanía, realiza todo tipo de trabajo con tela y bordado de chinelas. La Sra. Ysabel  también trabaja como cocinera en el hospital por el cual percibe algo de dinero extra, la Sra. se vio en la necesidad de solicitar crédito de nuestra institución debido a la necesidad y urgencia que posee de comprar una maquina nueva porque la que tiene se arruino hace poco. Ella  tiene un buen historial de deuda, es cliente antiguo  de la institución con buen comportamiento de pago,  cuenta con domicilio conocido, es una persona muy trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ysabel is 44 years old, single and has a 10 year old son. She works in dressmaking and handicrafts. She does different kinds of work with fabrics and the embroidery of slippers. She is also a cook at the hospital which provides some extra money.

She needs the loan from our institution to buy a new sewing machine because her old one broke recently. She has good credit history, is an old member with on time payments and resides at a known address. She is a hard working person who appreciates the support given by the institution.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine and increase capital

loans.name: Benk Group

texts.fr: Les femmes du groupe BENK sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans les familles conjugales élargies traditionnelles avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Elles résident dans le village de DIOUTIEBOUGOU de la préfecture de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de parenté. Après avoir rencontré beaucoup de difficultés à acheter des condiments au comptant avec leurs fournisseurs, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de développer leur pouvoir d’achat et cela pour faire la restauration et le commerce de charbons de bois. Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt ces Mariam D. compte acheter, 25 sacs de charbons de bois et 10 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe avec les producteurs de charbon de DIOUTIEBOUGOU. Elle revend en détail ou en gros, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Avec ce prêt les femmes désirent obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 25 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de santé et d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the BENK group are all married women who average 30 years of age and three children each. They live in extended traditional conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children, and husbands. They reside in the village of DIOUTIEBOUGOU, in the prefecture of BOUGOUNI, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They know one another through family ties. 

Having encountered many difficulties in buying condiments for cash from their suppliers, they decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to bolster their purchasing power in order to pursue their food services and charcoal sales activities. This is their ninth group loan, and all previous loans were correctly repaid. 

Mrs. Mariam D. will use her loan to buy 25 bags of charcoal and 10 cartloads of firewood from the coal producers of DIOUTIEBOUGOU. She sells at retail and wholesale, for cash and credit, to a mostly female clientele. 

With this loan, the members expect to earn a monthly profit of 25,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover the children’s health care expenses and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en: Bassam is a 42-year-old ambitious man who is married and has four daughters and two sons. Since he has a big family, Bassam can not depend only on his retirement salary to support his family so he searched for what he could do to have another source of income. After he retired from the Public Security Directorate, he decided to open a shop to sell used furniture, so he rented a place, re-decorated it and started to sell used furniture two years ago. Bassam’s Store has gained a good reputation in his area, and by the word of mouth, his business has been running smoothly since he launched it. Now Bassam wants to expand his business to include selling new furniture too, that’s why he applied for a loan.

loans.use: To expand his business to include selling new furniture

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni  es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos (agua, luz y desagüe) en el distrito de Tambogrande a  tan solo 30 minutos de distancia del departamento de Piura. Esta zona se caracteriza por su actividad agricola, ganadera y el turismo.

Marleni  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y es conocida por sus vecinos porque ofrece sus productos de casa en casa por todo su distrito.  Estos productos son para que las personas mejoren su imagen personal, en especial las mujeres y con esos ingresos se ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudar a su esposo económicamente.

Ha solicitado Marleni a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para adquirir más productos de belleza y ofertarlos a sus vecinos y tengan productos para escoger.  Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos de belleza cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

Marleni es una persona muy conocida por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Marleni is a 30-year old mother who lives with her husband and 2 children in their own house, which has basic utilities (water, electricity, and a drainage system). They live in the Tambogrande district, which is 30 minutes away from the department of Piura. This area is known for its agriculture, stockbreeding, and tourism.

Marleni sells beauty products for a living, and she is well-known by her neighbors because she offers her products door-to-door throughout her district. These products are used to improve personal image, especially for women. With her earnings, she is able to help her children get ahead and help her husband out financially.

Marleni has requested a 1,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa in order to obtain more beauty products so that her neighbors have a variety from which to choose. With the profits she earns from these beauty products, she will cover the loan repayment.

Marleni is a woman who is well-known for being a hard worker, a responsible person, and a good mother who wishes to give her children a better future and to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Judite Mateus

texts.pt:
Judite Mateus nasceu no Distrito de Manjacaze, Provincia de Gaza, Sul de Moçambique, casada e maê de 3 filhos de idades entre 11 a 19 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez 7ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa propria e sustenta um sobrinho e seus pais enviando algum valor para as despesas alimentares. 

Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo para dar continuidade com seus estudos porque na sua zona ja naõ tinha o nivel que ela devia frequentar. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade ha mais de 10 anos e consegue um rendimento de cerca 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.

Nunca  teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atraves de colegas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (oleo, arroz, refrescos, peixe, farinha e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 15.000.00mt,12.000.00mt e 15.000.00mt e foi para agro negocio.  

Compromete-se a pagar devidamente para aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos  empréstimos para adquirir um meio de transporte como forma de facilitar o escoamento da sua mercadoria.
texts.en:
Judite Mateus was born in Manjacaze District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children between 11 and 19 years old. All the children go to school. Judite finished 7th grade but did not continue because of financial problems. She lives in her own house and supports a nephew and her parents by sending them some money for food.

She left Manjacaze to move to Maputo so she could continue her studies, because in her area they did not have the grade she was supposed to be in. She has had her own business selling staple goods for more than 10 years, and her income is around 10,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and even saves some in her bank account.

Judite has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through coworkers who are customers of this institution. This is her fourth loan with Hluvuku, and she is asking for 20,000 meticais. She plans to buy products (oil, rice, soft drinks, fish, flour and other items) to increase her inventory. The earlier loans were for 15,000 meticais, 12,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais and were for the business.

She promises to make her payments promptly so she can get other loans in the future. She intends to take out more loans so she can buy a means of transport as a way to sell her merchandise more easily.

loans.use: to buy products (oil, rice, soft drinks, fish, flour, etc.).

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel, aged 39, is married to Gladys and blessed with four children. He sells handicrafts which he has been doing for eleven years.The business earns him a monthly income of KES.30,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He will use the loan funds to buy more handicrafts for resale. Ezekiel intends to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and hopes to join international exporters in future. He has never borrowed from any other MFI.

loans.use: To buy handicrafts for sale.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en: Verginia, 52 years old, is married to a bus driver. They were blessed with 3 children. She manage a plantation business. She has been in this business for almost 20 years. Her net income is 5,400 PHP, and she's asking a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase organic fertilizers for her vegetable plantation. She wants to thank Kiva lenders for their assistance in availing the loan and hopes lenders will continue to fund her loan requests in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers for her vegetable plantation.

loans.name: Angela Maria

texts.es: Ángela Maria tiene 45 años. Tiene la actividad económica que es brindar el servicio de nutrición. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella tomo cursos de nutrición y decide establecer este negocio con fondos propios. El dinero que solicita es para comprar productos naturales, pastillas, jarabes, pomadas entre otros. En sus deseos esta el seguir manteniendo este negocio ya que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en: Ángela Maria is 45 years old.  Her business activity is providing a nutrition service.  She has been in this business for more than three years.  She took courses in nutrition and decided to set up her business with her own funds.  She is requesting this money to buy natural products, pills, syrups, ointments, etc.  Her wish is to continue running her business as it is her only means of earning income.

loans.use: to buy natural products, pills, syrups and ointments

loans.name: Macario

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Ile, provincia da Zambezia, ao norte de Mocambique casado e pai de 5 filhos de idades entre 4 a 20 anos de idade os mais velhos vão a Escola. Fez a 8ª classe e parou porque teve que ir ao combate durante a guerra, e voltou com problemas de vista. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais dois irmãos, enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas alimentares.
Nasceu na Zambezia e veio a Maputo cumprindo o serviço militar obrigatorio, veio sozinho e mais tarde formou uma familia aqui. É funcionario permanente do Estado como policia de proteção a 35 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 10.433.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja fez emprestimo no BIM no valor de 54.000.00mt,para iniciar a sua obra o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificudades. Conheceu Hluvuku apos a sua fundação, e este e o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para sua obra CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA, OU SEJA, MORADIA (prancha, tabuas, areia, cimento, chapas, pedra, e outros).
Sonha em concluir a sua obra, iniciar um negocio para a sua esposa e comprar uma motocerra para fabricar carvão apos a sua reforma,e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the Ile district in the Zambezia province in northern Mozambique.  He is married and is the father of five children ranging in age from four to 20-years-old.  The oldest are in school.  He completed eight years of schooling and stopped because he had to go fight in the war and he returned with vision problems.  He lives in his own house with his family and maintains two siblings as well by sending them money to help with their food expenses.

He was born in Zambezia and went to Maputo to comply with obligatory military service.  He was single when he went and later formed a family there.  He has worked for 35 years as a protection officer with the police and a permanent state employee and has a monthly salary of 10,433 meticais which he uses for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (through the World Bank).

He has already taken out a loan with the World Bank in the amount of 54,000 meticais to start his building project which he was able to pay off with no difficulties.  He heard about Hluvuku through their foundation and this is his fourth loan with Hluvuku in the amount of 15,000 meticais which he plans to use to buy materials for his building project (boards, planks, sand, cement, sheet metal, stone, and others).

His dream is to complete his building project to start a business for his wife and buy a chainsaw to make charcoal after his retirement and to do this he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy materials for his building project (boards, planks, sand, cement, sheet metal, stone, and others).

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja Juan y con 5 de sus 7 hijos, pues los dos mayores trabajan independientes. Ellos viven en armonía familiar en el caserío de Cumutay. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la agricultura, siembra junto a su esposo papa, alverjas, maíz y flores de gladiolo, y aunque afirma que el trabajo debe ser muy dedicado, durante todos los días vigila con paciencia sus campos, hasta la espera de la cosecha, mientras cuida a sus animales como: vacas, toros, ovejas y cerdos. Y cuando llega el tiempo para recoger toda su buena producción observa la recompensa a todo su esfuerzo, y carga junto a sus familiares todos los pesados sacos con los productos naturales, que vende a regulares precios a los mayoristas que vienen  de la ciudad. Además le gusta mucho este; en la actualidad le permite brindarle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. Como si fuera poco también prepara y comercializa comida en la feria de la ciudad.  Y como es una mujer emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para mejorar sus ganancias. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Lindo amanecer de Cumutay” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde promete que será muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, además está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero del crédito. Basilia de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para distribuir en sus cultivos de alverja y papa de la variedad “única”; ya que hace 3 meses sembró y tienen que ser nutridos y fortificados.
texts.en:
Basilia, 46, lives in her own house with her partner, Juan and 5 of their 7 children since the two oldest work on their own.  They live in harmony in the village of Cumutay.  This hardworking woman is a farmer together with her husband.  She plants potatoes, field peas, corn and gladiolus, and  she says that they have to be very dedicated to the work and watch her fields patiently.  She waits for the harvest while caring for her animals such as: cows, bulls, sheep and pigs.  When harvest time of their good crops comes, she sees the rewards of all their effort and she and her relatives carry the heavy sacks of their products.  She sells them at competitive prices to the wholesalers who come to the city.  What she likes also is that currently the work allows her to offer her family a good quality of life.  As if it were nothing she also prepares and sells food in the city market.
And since she is an enterprising woman in the future she plans to plant more to improve her earnings.
She belongs to the communal bank “Lindo Amanacer de Cumutay” (Beautiful Dawn of Cumutay) and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She promises to be very punctual with her payments and she is very grateful to all the people who made the financing possible.  Basilia will use the loan to buy various sacks of natural fertilizers to spread on her crops of special field peas and potatoes since she planted them three months ago and they have to be fed and fortified.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Nhan is a housewife. Her husband is a construction worker earning $2 per day for his income. She has two children, 5 years old and 2 months old. The older one is studying. Every month, she spends $80 on food, $10 on school fees, and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her husband to travel to work and also to provide motor taxi service when he is off work. She wants to help her husband to earn money to support the family so she has a plan to buy grocery goods to sell at home when she can save enough money.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband's travel to work.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en: 27-year-old Janette earns a living through farming. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Janette works for her family. Janette says she is able to provide for her family through her business. She hopes to continue generating income from her farm. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, Janette hopes to have a stable business and successful children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Editha has been in this business for 9 years.

Editha requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, pants, etc. to sell to customers. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants etc. to sell to customers

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 29 years old and lives in Labo Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Emma is a buyer of coconuts. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 14,900 Philippines pesos to purchase more coconut fruits for her business.

Emma has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Emma hopes to have a lot of capital and be a copra (dried meat of the coconut) buyer. Emma is a (MIGS) Member In Good Standing of PMPC. She is a hardworking mother and an honest person who takes good care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut fruits for her business.

loans.name: Ishkhan

texts.en:
Ishkhan is 58 years old. He lives in Yerevan with his wife, who does not have a job. Ishkhan’s son lives and works in the Russian Federation.  For more than 30 years, Ishkhan has run a workshop where he repairs cars. He repurposed his home garage to do this. He has a lot of experience and therefore has never had a shortage of clients. He sometimes buys old and broken cars to repair and sell. Thanks to his business, Ishkhan is able to provide for his family.

Ishkhan is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to purchase a broken car to repair and resell.

loans.use: to buy a car to repair and resell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a widow and blessed with three children who are still in school.  She runs a hardware shop to support her  family. She has been in this business for three years.  She also runs a green grocer to earn extra income.  She has employed one person to help her manage the business.  

Mercy is requesting for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy paints and bolts for resale. In the next 5 years, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: buy paints and bolts

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana Carolina tiene 22 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene un hijo , vive con el esposo y con el hijo de 25 días de nacido  en Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

LA VRC DULCE SENTIMIENTO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Caimito II, parroquia  Puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Diana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul las compras y las ventas las realiza en el Cantón ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá agrandar la cantidad de trabajo en el campo y comprar los insumos y semillas sin ningún problema.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes ninguno. El sueño es seguir trabajando para poder comprar más terreno.
En los tiempos libres le gusta bailar.
texts.en:
Diana Carolina is 22, is in a common-law relationship, and has a son. She lives with her husband and 25 day-old son in Ventanas in Los Rios province. The "Dulce Sentimiento" communal bank is located in Recinto Caimito II, in Puerto Pechiche parish, which is part of Pueblo Viejo canton.  

The members of this communal bank work in short cycle agriculture, and grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Diane grows corn, rice, and pigeon peas. They carry out their purchases and sales in Ventanas canton.

She is applying for the loan to buy seeds, and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicides, fertilizers, and weed killer, in order to maintain her crop in good condition. 

The loan will be a big help because she will be able to expand her production, and buy supplies and seeds with no difficulty. 

Her dream is to keep  working, in order to buy more land. In her free time she likes to dance.

loans.use: To buy seeds, and agricultural supplies such as urea, herbicides, fertilizers, and weed killer.

loans.name: Stevenia's Group

texts.en:
Stevenia's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Stevenia is 22 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with one of them currently in school. For the past year, Stevenia has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Stevenia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar and soap for resale, and will help Stevenia to generate greater profits and pay school fees and medical expenses. Stevenia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Stevenia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Stevenia's future prospects by helping her to learn life planning skills like how to be assertive.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Bertha Concepcion

texts.es:
La Sra.Bertha tiene 32 años, está acompañada con el Sr. Crispín viven en la Ciudad de Itá. Ella tiene una pequeña granja donde cria gallinas, patos, chanchos, guineas y ademas posee vacas que producen una buena cantidad de leche que pone a la venta, su vaca lechera produce 30 litros de leche por día.
Ella comenta que trabaja mucho todos los días para poder criar a sus animales y para que gracias a eso pueda tener un mejor ingreso con lo que podrá ayudar en los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales, ya que le será de mucha ayuda. La Sra. Bertha se define como una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, que día a día se sacrifica para llevar adelante su pequeña granja.
texts.en:
Bertha, 32, lives with Crispín in the city of Itá.  She has a small farm where she raises chickens, ducks, pigs and guinea pigs.  In addition, she has cows that produce a good amount of milk that she sells; her dairy cow produces about 30 liters of milk per day.

She comments that she works hard every day to be able to raise her animals so that she can earn better income to help with household expenses.

She’s asking for a loan to buy animal feed which will be of much help.  Bertha defines herself as a hardworking, responsible person who sacrifices day to day to make progress with her little farm.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Feryal

texts.en:
Feryal is 36 years old and widowed. She works in a photography studio taking photos for people whether in the studio or at their parties such as  wedding parties.

After gaining experience in photography, Feryal decided to start her own business using her connections, so as a start she has applied for a loan to buy a new  professional digital camera and a PC so she can one day have her own studio.

loans.use: to buy a new professional  digital camera and a PC.

loans.name: Nzuki

texts.en:
Nzyuki is a passion fruit farmer who lives in the Likoni are of Kenya. He is married and has seven children. When Nzyuki sold his farm produce a few months back, he was enlightened about passion fruit farming and investing the sales into the project. It has continued to give him returns. He has been running the business for the last four years.

He is applying for a loan KES 20,000 to pay for the transportation of his produce from the farm to the market. He has the ambition of supplying produce to various parts of the country.

Nzyuki will use the extra income from the business to purchase fertilizers.

loans.use: To pay for the transportation of his produce from the farm to the market.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina nació en la ciudad de Calca y donde vive, ella tiene 45 años edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con su trabajo, ella es profesora y trabaja  en uno de los colegios más importantes de la ciudad de Calca, ella  trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde de lunes a viernes. Ya son 10 años que se desempeña su carrera profesional y le va muy bien pero el sueldo que le paga el estado no le alcanza para los gastos del hogar entonces se las ingenio para abrir un negocio. El negocio que abrió es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, ella en esta oportunidad vio que el negocio está creciendo entonces ella necesita más capital de trabajo por lo tanto requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes y gallinas. 

Luz Marina es integrante del grupo “Virgen de Asunta de Calca” lo conforman 15 socios que viven en la ciudad de Calca de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
texts.en:
Luz Marina was born in the city of Calca where she lives.  She is 45 years old and has a partner with whom she has two children.  She alternates her home duties with her work.  She is a teacher and and works at one of the most important schools in the city of Calca.  She works from eight in the morning until one in the afternoon Monday through Friday.  She has had her professional career for 10 years now and it is going very well for her, but the salary the state pays her doesn't cover her household expenses, so she found a way to start a business.  The business she started is that of raising small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She saw that this business is growing and so she needs more working capital, which is why she needs this loan to buy more guinea pigs and chickens.

Luz Marina is a member of the Virgen de Asunta de Calca Group, which is made up of 15 members who live in the city of Calca in the Calca Province of the department of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs and chickens

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: La señora Francisca se dedica a la venta de chompas hace 17 años estas prendas son  para hombres, mujeres y niños el puesto esta ubicado en una avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz, la Sra. Comenzó con un capital mínimo y gracias a la ayuda que le brindo la institución actualmente tiene un puesto surtido con todo tipo de prendas de distintos precios. El domicilio de la Sra. Esta ubicado en la zona de villa san Antonio junto al apoyo de su esposo lograron salir adelante en la actualidad el esposo sr. Melitón  trabaja de garzón en distintas zonas de la ciudad, la Sra. Francisca solicita el  crédito esta destinado a incrementar su capital comprando ropa al por mayor por la demanda de fin de año, ya que esta época tiene mucha venta, la Sra. francisca se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca has been selling sweaters for 17 years. These garments are for men, women, and children. Her vending post is located along one of the busiest avenues in the city of La Paz. Sra. Francisca started with minimal capital. Thanks to the assistance Emprender provided, she currently has a well-stocked post with all types of garments at different prices.

Her home is located in the District of Villa San Antonio where she lives with her husband. They have been able to forge ahead together. Her husband, Sr. Melitón, currently works as a waiter in different parts of the city. Sra. Francisca is requesting a loan so that she can increase her capital for buying clothes in bulk that are in demand for the year-end season. She has many sales during this time. Sra. Francisca is grateful for the support Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy clothing for the year-end season.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 30 years old. She has owned a food stall for the past year. She wants the loan to buy more foodstuffs such as sugar and rice to sell. She will use the profits to renovate her house. In the future, Josephine dreams to own a shop.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a practical woman. She has no higher education or work experience, only her wits and her desire to succeed in life. She is a very hardworking, progressive, and honest farmer from a very remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. This area is very fertile, with favorable weather patterns that support farming activities. 

Hellen is happily married and the proud mother of a lovely family, and together they live on a small piece of land that she really treasures. Her primary sources of income are eggs and milk. Although this humble and industrious mother makes a profit, she faces the challenge of not being able to produce enough to meet the ready market that is available. Therefore, she is seeking funds from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs like good fertilizer and good-quality seeds. 

Through this loan, she will double her production, and this will translate into increased income. She then intends to save more money in the future so that she can develop her farming and also build a new modern house. This loan will help Hellen to realize her dream of getting out of poverty, and she will be able to secure her family's future.

Lenders! If there is someone that you should invest in, then that person is Hellen. She will not let you down.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 53 years old, married with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Thelma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Thelma requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Thelma has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.en:
Akouwa K. was born in Tabligbo, in the prefecture of Yoto, on October 30, 1979. She is married, the mother of a children, and the guardian of another child. Her husband, who is a scrap metal merchant, goes from construction site to construction site looking for work. Nearly all household expenses rest on the shoulders of Mrs. K.. Five years ago, she began her business selling tomatoes using the paltry resources she had at the time. Her business has not changed significantly since its beginnings due to insufficient capital. It is doing OK now, because of her devotion and determination, and so she is deserving of financial support today.

Towards the goal of improving her business, Mrs. K. is requesting a loan of $750 for keeping a big enough inventory to meet the demands of her customers. To finance this women is to rescue her entire family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame K. Akouwa est née le 30 Octobre 1979 à Tabligbo dans la préfecture de Yoto. Mariée et mère d’un (01) enfant, elle élève un autre enfant d’un proche parent. Son mari est un ferrailleur qui va de chantier en chantier pour rechercher du travail. La presque totalité des charges du ménage reposent sur la femme. Elle a commencé ses activités de vente de tomate il y a 5 ans avec les moyens dérisoires qu’elle disposait. Cette activité qui n’avait pas connu une évolution significative au départ pour insuffisance de fonds de commerce, est aujourd’hui assez florissante à cause du dévouement et la détermination de Madame K. Akouwa qui mérite d’être soutenue financièrement aujourd’hui.

Dans le but d’améliorer son commerce, Madame K. sollicite un crédit de $750 qui va lui servir à faire un stock suffisant pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Financer cette femme, c’est sauver toute une famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling various produce, such as tomatoes

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.en: Hello, my name is Martha. My primary activity is making and selling reed baskets. I have been doing this type of work from my home for several years. I have a good client base, and to me, the most important thing is to be able to help my family and generate an income to cover my family’s expenses. My children also help me during their free time.

loans.use: Purchase of reeds (raw material)

loans.name: Edilia

texts.en:
Edilia is 32 years old, she is married and has 1 child. Her business is 4 years old and she sells all kind of clothing, from men's socks to lady's cowboy boots.

She invested a previous loan in the purchase of winter clothing, which enabled her to realize several orders of fixed customers. With the income of her business, she can pay for the family expenses as well as for her studies: she is studying Administration.

In the beginning, it was hard for her to start her business as she didn't have the capital necessary. She could make her first investments thanks to her first loan. Her business is growing, and she is thinking about opening another subsidiary. In this enterprise, Edilia is helped by her sister, also a student, who is doing a market study and who will be responsible to run the new store. In order to succeed with this, Edilia want to re-activate her credit line with Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Edilia tiene 32 años, está casada y tiene 1 hijo. Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de 4 años donde vende todo tipo de ropa desde medias para caballeros hasta camperas para damas. La inversión del préstamo, lo destinó a la compra de ropas de invierno, lo cual posibilito la realización de varios pedidos de clientes habituales. Los ingresos que le genera este negocio, permite cubrir los gastos propios de su familia además de los gastos de su estudio, ya que está cursando la carrera de Administración

Al inicio fue muy duro y difícil para ella poder iniciar este negocio ya que no contaba con el capital necesario, y las primeras inversiones realizadas fueron gracias al préstamo al cual accedió. Su negocio está creciendo y ya tiene pensado más adelante abrir otra sucursal. En este emprendimiento Edilia cuenta con el apoyo y acompañamiento de su hermana, también estudiante, quien está llevando adelante los estudios de mercado y quien sería la responsable de atender el nuevo negocio. Para concretar este proyecto tiene pensado activar nuevamente su línea de crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: To buy ladies' lingerie and men's clothing

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en: Mr. Vusal is an IDP from the occupied Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993 and started his private business the same year. He is 28 and single. He had a very low income before and decided to apply for a $550 loan from Normicro Baku branch to solve his problems.  With his next loan he plans to buy a modern electronic scale for his shop.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Jawiyah
