Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará  materias primas en mayor volumen para producir productos derivados de la harina de trigo, pues se proyecta un aumento de estos insumos y quiere adquirirlos antes de que ocurra; así mismo comprará víveres, abarrotes, refrescos, pues  está muy atento a tener surtido su negocio con lo que requiere su clientela,  en fechas especiales como la que se acerca : El día del padre, época en la cual su negocio tiene gran movilidad comercial.
texts.en: Angel lives in the community of Soledad 2000 with his common-law partner. He has a business. His experience dates back 20 years when he started working in this business, but he has had his own business for the past 8 years. He profited from his extensive knowledge in the field to maintain the stability of his business and it is reflected in the considerable number of steady clients. His goal is to have his own store space and this is why he plans on maintaining his business in the ideal and to increase his working capital. This is the first loan he has had with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and he will purchase ingredients in larger quantities to make wheat products. There is a projected increase in price of these ingredients and he wants to acquire them before this happens. He will also purchase food products, grocery products and soft drinks. He is very concerned in keeping his business well stocked with what his clients require. During special days, as the one approaching, Father's Day, is when he has more business.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of ingredients such as wheat products, food products, grocery store proudcts, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a widow with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Riziki operates a food-stall business, selling retail to her neighbors and passersby. Her major goal in the business is to expand and establish a restaurant. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and milk for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, and milk for her food stall business

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en:
Damira, 29, is the treasurer of this group. She chose to get involved in trading vegetables and fruits, and became quite successful despite the fact that she was younger than most of her colleagues. She has her own ideas of running and promoting the business. 

When in season, she purchases strawberries wholesale from her parents who grow them in a village called Kun Tuu, and she resells them to local grocery stores and bazaars. Gradually she added other vegetables like cucumbers, tomatoes and cabbage to her assortment. She calls it a family business because when her husband is free from his main job as a security officer, he provides the transportation for the goods. At present she has 2,500 soms in circulation and is requesting a loan in order to buy more berries and vegetables. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Marcos Benedo

texts.es:
Marcos Benedo tiene 30 años, Es soltero vive con solo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL PROGRESO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocache, perteneciente al Cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a laborea de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz

Marco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz por mas de 5 años. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es comprar un carro y tener casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte y visitar a los hijos.
texts.en:
Marcos Benedo is 30 years old.  He’s single and lives alone in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  He has three children.

The members of the “El Progreso” (Progress) communal bank are located in Aguas Frías de Mocache belonging to Mocache Canton and are dedicated to short cycle corn and rice farming tasks.

Marco has been farming corn and rice for over five years.  He buys his supplies at Comercial Peña and sells at the Ventanas wholesale market.

He is asking for the loan to plant corn and rice, to buy farming supplies and fertilizer for his crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  His dream is to buy a car and have a house of his own.

He enjoys playing sports and visiting his children.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: La señora Rosmery oriunda de la localidad de San José Santa Cruz, vive con el sr. Rider, tienen dos hijos pequeños, viven en su propio domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en el zona los pinos, su actividad económica es venta de ropa, joyas y productos cosméticos por catalogo de las distintas empresas de cosméticos a nivel mundial, hace ocho años que se dedica a esta actividad, también sale a vender comida los fines de semana en el mercado de la zona. El destino del crédito es para la compra de mercadería (cosméticos de promoción), se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Rosmery is originally from the town of San José in Santa Cruz. She lives with Sr. Rider and they have two young children. They live in their own home in the District of Los Pinos. Rosmery has a business selling clothes, jewelry, and cosmetics through catalogs of various international companies. She has been in business for eight years. Rosmery also sells food on the weekends at the local market.

This loan will be used to buy merchandise (cosmetics through a promotional offer). She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics through a promotional offer.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 19 years old and her youngest is five. Celsa's husband works as a farmer and carpenter. For the past four years, Celsa has been farming rice. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Celsa sells her rice harvest and pigs at the market in her town. 

Celsa is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes to be able to pay her children's tuition fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz, 52, is married and lives in the Philippines. She has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish and has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy dried fish to sell.

Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring/clothing sales business. Specifically, she makes dresses and sells them to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge due to the seasonality of her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase bundles of clothing materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothing materials for her tailoring/sales business.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman. She has eight  children, three of whom attend school while the other 5 children are married. They live at their own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past 10 years, Mose has operated a cattle selling business. She sells her cattle at the market to her neighbours and butcher shops. Her major challenges are disease outbreak and seasonality in her business.  She dreams of having her own slaughter house in the future.

With the KES 40,000.00 she wants to purchase herds of cattle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase herds of cattle.

loans.name: Abubakr

texts.ru: Абубакр житель города Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 24 года. У него четверо детей. Его жена не работает. Сам Абубакр предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Abubakr lives in the town of Vahdat.  He is 24 years old, married and has four children.  His wife does not work.  Abubakr provides a taxi service.  He has been involved in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and lives in small village of Bontod, Province of Siquijor.  She is married with four children.
To earn a living, Gina has a business selling of Assorted Fruits, Spices and Vegetables. She earns about PHP 5,000.00 every month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan amounting to fifteen thousand pesos for additional investment in the said business.

Gina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.  Gina would like to let her children finish studying now in college and land a good job in the future through the financial help of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase Fresh Fruits, Spices & Vegetables to sell in the market everyday

loans.name: Odette

texts.fr:
Odette est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est célibataire.  
Odette travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2005. Elle achète et revend des parfums et des assiettes 555, à toutes personnes à Lomé et dans ses marchés environnants. Elle achète ces produits au Grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule. 
Odette a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des parfums et des assiettes. Elle veut réinvestir les profits supplémentaires dans son commerce. 
Dans les prochaines années, Odette voudrait avoir un magasin de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit avoir une vie heureuse.
texts.en:
Odette is a 31-year-old woman. She is unmarried.
Odette has worked as a retailer since 2005. She buys and re-sells perfumes and '555' brand plates to all types of customers in Lomé and in the surrounding markets. She buys her goods at the grand market in Lomé. She works by herself.
Odette has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy perfumes and plates. She wants to reinvest her supplementary profits in her business.
In the coming years, Odette would like to have a sales store. She says that with her profits, she foresees having a happy life.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and plates.
